Beweg mit uns die Schweiz alsSenior Security Analyst (m/w)Ostermundigenab sofort oder nach Vereinbarung60-100%93096Darauf kannst du dich freuen.Als Teil des Security Operations Centers (SOC) bist du die erste Anlaufstelle für sicherheitsrelevante Vorfälle innerhalb des Unternehmens. Zusammen überwachen wir die IT-Systemlandschaft der SBB auf verdächtiges Verhalten und potenzielle Sicherheitsverletzungen, indem wir Sicherheitswarnungen einordnen und untersuchen. In der Rolle Lead Investigation im Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT) bearbeitest du kritische Vorfälle und trägst dazu bei, das Thema Cyber-Sicherheit in der SBB AG langfristig und nachhaltig voranzutreiben.Das kannst du bewegen.Als Senior Security Analyst (m/w) im Cyber Defense Programm der SBB unterstützt du die bereits etablierten Prozesse des SOC und hilfst dabei, das Thema in der SBB AG langfristig und nachhaltig voranzutreiben.Als Incident Responder trägst du dazu bei, das SOC-Team in der Fallbearbeitung von Sicherheitslücken und Risiken innerhalb des Unternehmens sowie die Weiterentwicklung der Detektionsfähigkeiten des Cyber Defence Centers der SBB AG zu stärken.Neben der Analyse und Bearbeitung von Security Incidents entwickelst du Use Cases, Play- und Runbooks und automatisierte Abläufe im Incident Prozess.Beim aktiven Threat Hunting identifizierst du Sicherheitsrisiken aufgrund von Bedrohungs- und Verwundbarkeitsbeurteilungen und bewertest die Auswirkungen auf unsere Systemlandschaft.Das bringst du mit.Als empathische Persönlichkeit kannst du auch in anspruchsvollen und heiklen Situationen sowie bei strittigen Themen mit verschiedensten Interessengruppen erfolgreich lösungsorientiert im Sinne der Sicherheitsanforderungen des Unternehmens kommunizieren.Du bringst eine mehrjährige Erfahrung im IT-Security-Umfeld als Security Analyst oder als Incident Handler im SOC/CERT/CSIRT oder als Operations-naher Security Engineer mit.Du verfügst über vertiefte Kenntnisse in den Bereichen Log-Analyse, EDR, SIEM und SOAR.Mit Query Sprachen wie Microsoft KQL oder Splunk SPL kennst du dich aus.Du kennst dich mit Microsoft Defender Produkten, Azure oder AWS Security Tools aus und du bist vertraut mit MITRE ATT&CK und Cyber Kill Chain Modellen.Damit gelingt der Einstieg.Dass du mit uns die Schweiz bewegen willst, ist für uns die grösste Motivation. Darum verzichten wir bei dieser Stelle auf ein Motivationsschreiben. Falls du uns deine Motivation dennoch mitteilen möchtest, hast du in unserem Bewerbungstool nach wie vor die Möglichkeit dazu. Grosses machen ist einfacher per du. Das beginnt bereits bei deiner Bewerbung.Für diese Stelle nehmen wir keine Dossiers von Personalvermittlern entgegen.Zur StelleMirco Bigler Telefon +41 51 285 44 00

job_title: Senior Quantitative Analyst, CH & Int. Mortgage Models
job_description:
Job Reference #286918BRJob TypeFull TimeYour roleDo you have experience in credit risk modelling and analytics? Do you have knowledge of real estate valuation models? Are you a problem-solving person and a constructive challenger, motivated to contribute to highly specialized solutions?In your role as Senior Quantitative Analyst, you'll: verify and enhance valuation models and CO2 calculation models procured from external vendors assess and define model specifications perform impact and sensitivity analyses discuss business requirements, modelling options and impacts with stakeholders prepare model documentations and perform model performance and confirmation testing support model implementation and changes to productive models collaborate with vendors and internal stakeholders from Risk Control, Front Office and ITYour teamYou will be working within Retail Credit Risk Methodology in the CH & Int. Mortgage Modeling team in Zurich. We are focusing on Real Estate Valuation and CO2 calculation models in Switzerland and ensure that our models are fit for purpose from a risk and procedural perspective. We also support the subsequent implementation and use of the models into the productive IT environment. To effectively design performant solutions, we have to develop a deep understanding of the portfolio specifics, products and respective markets and actively collaborate with external vendors and various internal stakeholders.Diversity helps us grow, together. That’s why we are committed to fostering and advancing diversity, equity, and inclusion. It strengthens our business and brings value to our clients.Your expertise master degree or equivalent education in business administration, banking and finance, data science or econometrics as well as relevant work experience strong analytical and conceptual skills combined with good statistical understanding good knowledge of Microsoft Office (in particular Excel), experience in VBA, LaTex, programming and the use of statistical software (e.g. Python, SAS) is a plus understanding of financial markets and products know-how of real estate markets, sustainability and valuation methods is a plus good communication skills and the ability to translate complex and technical problems into a clear and intuitive language organized, collaborative and pro-active personality who is able to work and plan independently fluent in English, good reading comprehension in GermanAbout UsUBS is the world’s largest and the only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors..We have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries.Join usAt UBS, we embrace flexible ways of working when the role permits. We offer different working arrangements like part-time, job-sharing and hybrid (office and home) working. Our purpose-led culture and global infrastructure help us connect, collaborate, and work together in agile ways to meet all our business needs.From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we’re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?Disclaimer / Policy StatementsUBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

Job DescriptionSystems Engineer – Public SectorWe are looking for a Systems Engineer to work closely with a sales representative in a defined territory. The Systems Engineer's main mission will be to support the sales organization in all technical matters regarding pre-sales, sales calls, and post-sales.With us you will Lead all technical aspects of a sales cycle with the Enterprise customers, from the initial RFIs, through to RFPs & RFQs when required. This includes the project management and active participation in POCs in partnership with the relevant teams both internally and within the customer and/or commercial partner. Have the ability to listen and to understand the technical requirements of the customer, reading between the lines to build a solution which outperforms the competitor offering. Be the primary technical point of contact for the customer(s) and partners in close collaboration with your sales partner. Continuously strive to improve knowledge around the Fortinet products and solutions, along with maintaining a deep understanding of the competitive landscape and Fortinet’s ability to provide long lasting protection against the ever-evolving threats. Have a strong ability to position Fortinet solutions to the customer, whether this be remotely or in person. This requires strong communication skills and the ability to confidently present through whiteboarding, technical white papers, technical plans or customer discussions. Manage your time effectively when working on multiple deals simultaneously, ensuring a positive customer experience is maintained. Maintain accurate activity, contact, and account technical information of all customers and prospects in our CRM (Salesforce). Apply if you Have a high aptitude for security technology, specifically encryption, authentication, with further knowledge of network security, intrusion detection, anti-virus, routing, switching, LAN and WAN being desirable. The CISSP accreditation would also be beneficial. Are currently or have previously worked in a pre-sales engineer role, managing end to end technical aspects of deals, through to technical closure. Can demonstrate your problem-solving skills and how this has impacted key wins within your current organisation. Understand and can demonstrate your ability to build and maintain customer relationships, including your ability to effectively communicate technically to a range of both external and internal stakeholders. Have a strong understanding of RADIUS, PKI, IKE, Certificates, L2TP, IPSEC, FIREWALL, 802.1Q, MD5, SSH, SSL, SHA1, DES, 3DES What You Can Expect From UsExcellent training and development opportunities, providing you with all the tools you need to be successful. An open working environment sharing knowledge and information collaboratively and transparently, with respect to everyone’s thoughts and opinions. The opportunity to be part of an innovative, collaborative and winning team. A competitive salary and incentive compensation package, including stock awards, health and welfare benefits. FortinetFrom the start, the Fortinet vision has been to deliver broad, truly integrated, high-performance security across the IT infrastructure. Today, we secure the largest enterprises, service providers and government organizations around the world.Fortinet empowers its customers with intelligent, seamless protection across the expanding attack surface and the power to take on ever-increasing performance requirements of the borderless network – today and into the future. We have proven to be a truly innovative technology driven network security company with over 619 registered Global Patents. This is over 3 times more than our closest most innovative competitor!About UsFortinet (NASDAQ: FTNT) secures the largest enterprise, service provider, and government organizations around the world. Fortinet empowers its customers with intelligent, seamless protection across the expanding attack surface and the power to take on ever-increasing performance requirements of the borderless network - today and into the future. Only the Fortinet Security Fabric architecture can deliver security without compromise to address the most critical security challenges, whether in networked, application, cloud or mobile environments. Fortinet ranks number one in the most security appliances shipped worldwide and more than 500,000 customers trust Fortinet to protect their businesses.

What you will move in this role:You lead the technical discussions with the customers during the project-definition phaseYou are responsible to support the Project team in clarifying the customer requirements and agreeing on the specification itemsYou actively search for new applications where existing products could be usedYou collect customer requests and present them to the organization as possible new product developments or design variants (new functions, new certification- for new markets, modified working parameters, customer-specific interface-tools)You maintain close communication with the project team to synchronize about the product status, functionality and development scheduleYou train the Sales Engineer and the Product Engineer about the product characteristics, functionality, product limitations, etc.You work together with the Product Engineer in preparing and updating the product documentation needed by BRUSA Customers (Provide content for the product documentation)You support for Product documentation improvement, based on Customer feedback (Toolchain, bug-tracking, FAQ /database, guidelines, etc.), together with Product and Sales EngineeringIf necessary, you also work in the labWhat skills and experience you should bring:You successfully completed your studies in electrical engineering or physics (University Degree or University of Applied Sciences)You have proven in-depth experience in the development of power converters (DC/DC, PFC) for series in the Automotive sectorYou are proficient in calculating and simulating control loopsYou ideally have already gained experience in using Altium Designer and PADSYour way of working is structured, organized and analyticalYou have strong interpersonal skills, enjoy working in a team and are creativeYour English skills are very good (spoken and written)German is a plusWhat makes us unique:We are passionate about E-Mobility and have the vision to make a positive contribution to our environment and society. Do you enjoy implementing your own ideas with a lot of creative freedom? Then we are looking forward to your application (including CV, school and university certificates and cover letter) to:BRUSA HyPower AGHajo KlemmerHR ManagerT: +41 81 758 1904

Description:Senior Financial Analyst Mitek AGP- PIC COELooking after the world, one person at a time has encouraged and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for over 135 years. We encourage research and science - bringing innovative ideas, products, and services to advance the health and well-being of people.With $99.1 billion in 2023 sales, J&J is the world's most diversified manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices markets. There are more than 265 J&J operating companies employing approximately 140,000 people and with products touching the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world. If you have the talent and desire to touch the world, Johnson & Johnson has the career opportunities to help make it happen.DePuy Synthes, a market-leading Medical Devices business within Johnson & Johnson, has an outstanding opportunity for a Senior Financial Analyst within the HMD Principal, Inventory and Costing, Centre of Excellence (PIC COE). This Senior Analyst position operates in a dynamic global environment supporting multiple Worldwide Business Unit Directors to achieve inventory targets and deliver inventory reductions and efficiencies.Main Duties and ResponsibilitiesThe core responsibility of this role will be to support all aspects of reporting, forecasting and analysis of AGP for the WW Mitek franchise, including but not limited to:Primary Finance business partner for the Mitek AGP across five sites and currencies.Consolidation of Affiliate Gross Profit results.Prepare accurate and timely submissions on a quarterly basis for all actual and forecasting cycles.Forecasting foreign currency exposure for monthly submission.Present results and variance drivers to senior finance leadership.Utilise all information sources and tools available to provide relevant analysis and insights into variances.Investigate options and propose solutions to limit future impacts.Collaborating closely within own team and with HMD Finance business partners across the PIC COE with regard to AGP submissions and supporting related improvement projects.Timely communication of business-related issues or opportunities with the next management level.Drive improvements within area of responsibility. Challenge established norms and processes to deliver tangible benefits in scope of control, predictability, efficiency, and effectiveness.Become a valued member of the team, taking on additional tasks and responsibilities as required.Ensure compliance to WWPs and SOX controls.Maintaining the highest compliance standards and assisting in audit and SOX compliance testing. Qualifications:Essential:Bachelor’s degree or equivalentQualified ACCA, ACA or CIMA accountantDesirable:3+ years of relevant multinational experienceSupply chain finance experience in medical device or pharmaceutical industry an advantageProven track record in multicultural business partnering.Experience of tools like Power BI, Alteryx, TableauKey competenciesGood analytical and communication skills.Ability to work under pressure to meet tight deadlines.Excellent interpersonal skills, be a team player and willing to work in a flexible environment. Results orientated with strong ownership and accountability for results. Accuracy with attention to detail.Strong technical accounting and compliance knowledge.Demonstrated record of driving continuous improvements in execution.Ability to translate complex situations into simple working solutions.Ability to build effective partnering relationships using persuading and influencing skills.Accuracy with attention to detail.Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks simultaneously while meeting deadlines.Proactive, energetic, and enthusiastic approach.Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Impress your customer – das ist das Versprechen an die Kunden von unserem ROCKEN Partner. Der Software-Hersteller bietet eine ganzheitliche Plattform für die Digitalisierung der Kundenbeziehung. Mit Lösungen für Customer Relationship Management (CRM), Customer Experience (CX), Data Management (CDP), Customer Insights und Artifical Intelligence (AI) hilft er Unternehmen dabei, Kunden in Echtzeit entlang der gesamten Customer Journey zu begeistern. Marketing, Sales und Service Teams haben somit alles zur Hand, was sie für kanalübergreifende, automatisierte und personalisierte Kundenkommunikation benötigen. Für Retail, Banking und Insurance bietet dieser ROCKEN Partner starke spezialisierte Lösungen auf Basis langjähriger Branchenexpertise.Deine VerantwortungDu bist verantwortlich für die Evaluation, Konzeption und Weiterentwicklung neuer ICT-Lösungen und -Standards sowie die selbstständige Umsetzung. Du überwachst und automatisierst ICT-Systeme an verschiedenen Standorten in Deutschland und der Schweiz. Du unterstützt die Software-Projekte im Bereich System Engineering. Du analysierst und bearbeitest User-Feedbacks und Störungen.Deine SkillsDu besitzt entweder einen Hochschulabschluss (Bachelor oder Master) von einer ETH, FH oder Uni oder verfügst über entsprechende Berufserfahrung mit Weiterbildung. Du hast Erfahrung im Bereich IT-Infrastruktur, einschließlich Integration, Konfiguration und Betrieb. Dein Wissen im Bereich Linux und Microsoft Umgebungen ermöglicht es dir, diese mit Cloud- und On-Premises-Systemen wie M365, Azure, Exchange, Teams und SharePoint zu integrieren. Du hast auch Erfahrung mit Active Directory, AAD, ADFS, GPOs, DNS und DHCP. Darüber hinaus verfügst du über Kenntnisse im Bereich Virtualisierungen, sowohl Hypervisor als auch Containerisierung. Deine Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse sind sehr gut.BenefitsAttraktive Weiterbildungs- und EntwicklungsmöglichkeitenInteressante und abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeiten/ProjekteEingespieltes und dynamisches Team Flache HierarchienROCKEN Jobs:https://rocken.jobsProfil erstellen:https://rocken.jobs/application/profil-erstellen/

Job DescriptionAs “Intune Engineer” within our growing Endpoint Management team you will play a key role in managing and maintaining our Intune environment to ensure secure, efficient and seamless device management. You will work closely with other engineers to implement, configure, and optimize Microsoft Intune for our organization’s device management and endpoint security needs.Tasks:Design, implement, and manage Intune policies, profiles, and configurations;Develop and enforce endpoint security and compliance policies;Execution of projects and initiatives in the field of modern device management;Monitor and troubleshoot Intune-related issues and provide timely resolutions;Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment with business objectives;Document MDM-related processes properly and share information with support teams;Monitor technology trends and seek ways to enhance continuous improvement initiatives;Function as an escalation point for complex technical problems for Service Desk and other IT teams;Ability to perform lifecycle management for operating systems and applications such as hotfixes, service packs, software, and OS deployments according to a release management process. RequirementsBachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field (or equivalent experience);Proven experience in managing and configuring Microsoft Intune for device management and security;Strong knowledge of mobile device management (MDM) and endpoint security;Familiarity with Intune app deployment and conditional access policies;Application packaging experience;Experience with Microsoft 365, Entra ID, Group Policies and other related technologies;Scripting and automation skills (PowerShell or other scripting languages);Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting abilities;Strong English communication and collaboration skills.BenefitsHome Office: after the successful probation period you will meet your colleagues three days in the office and have the option to work two days a week in the home office in Switzerland. Additionally you get a Home Office allowance;We have flexible working hours and you can structure your working hours according to operational requirements;A diverse culture full of mutual respect, teamwork and appreciation awaits you at LGT Capital Partners – we‘re all working hard but with us you can really generate an impact;We empower and invest in you: your professional and personal development is key at our company: therefore we offer you internal and external trainings aligned with our business needs. If you‘re interested, you can also intensify your German or English skills;We‘re proud to be owned by the Princely family of Liechtenstein and our successful company is greatly inspired by their entrepreneurial attitude;Commitment to ESG: our thinking is characterized through the Princely Family by a long term perspective. Sustainability is key - we act accordingly in business and private life since 2002.Contact InformationIf you are interested in becoming an integral part of a successful alternative investment management team in an international, multicultural working environment we will be pleased to get to know you soon.For further information please contact us.Alexandra HohermuthHuman ResourcesLGT Capital Partners AG, PfaeffikonContact:+41 58 261 86 62

Sie koordinieren überwachen und arbeiten aktiv an Supportanfragen der Kunden und erstellen die notwendigen Tickets beim Hersteller. Im besten Fall DMS/ECM Kenntnisse Bereitschaft neues zu lernen Deutsch in B1 Level Englisch B1 Level

job_title: NGPA Cluster Lead “Governance | Data Inventory | Enterprise Data Model”
job_description:
Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.In this role, you will be responsible to lead all activities in the NewGen PA Data Tower on Data Inventory and a to be designed Enterprise Data Model in close collaboration with Divisions driven activities in the same field. Support and work with the Tower Lead on Data Governance with in the NewGen PA scope to complement existing frameworks from CFIN and HRTP. Manage the internal and external teams involved, support the tool selection for EDM and other related tools. Deliver input to other related Clusters in the NewGen PA Data Tower, such as Data Cleansing, Migration planning, etc. Work in close collaboration with the Technology Tower for the selection and implementation of tools to fit into the new overall architecture.Your responsibilitiesIdentification and recording of existing data object and future data objects, based on future process designs.Define objectives and use cases for the Enterprise Data Model.Conceptualize EDM, incl. tool and future application of the model, including benefits to the organization.Marketing of the concept to all relevant stakeholders in the divisions.Collecting of the reporting requirements (data quality dashboard, framework, etc.).Complete analysis of existing concepts (CFIN, HRTP)Support the Data Tower-lead to finalize NewGen PA Governance framework.Application of Framework to EDMDefine and implement the organizational requirements to run the Governance Model together with the Data Tower-lead.Start setup organization and framework.Your backgroundBachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, or a related field.Proven experience (3-5 years) as a Data Analyst or similar role, with a track record of designing and implementing effective data models.Deep understanding of project managementSound knowledge of related toolsData Base FunctionalityInterface technologiesMicrosoft office and SharePointMore about usABB is a leading global technology company that energizes the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future. The Process Automation (PA) business area (>$6B revenue in 2021, 22,000 employees), automates, electrifies and digitalizes some of the most complex industrial infrastructures on this planet. Through its five divisions, it serves customers in the energy, process and hybrid industries – from hydrocarbons, chemicals, water, mining, minerals, pulp & paper to marine and ports, and many more. PA stands at the heart of some of the most important shifts in society, helping the energy-intense industries to safer, smarter and more sustainable operations to enable a prosperous, low-carbon society. For more information on PA, refer to https://global.abb/group/en/investors/strategy-events/pa-capital-markets-day-2022We look forward to receiving your application (documents submitted in English are appreciated). If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com.90355472

abwechslungsreichen Position im dynamischen Umfeld einer Fachhochschule flexiblen Arbeitszeiten sowie attraktiven Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten und guten Sozialleistungen Arbeitsort an zentraler Lage job_title: Assistenzprofessur für Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Data Science in Radiation Oncology
job_description:
An der Medizinischen Fakultät der Universität Bern und dem Universitätsspital (Inselspital) Bern ist eineAssistenzprofessur für Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Data Science in Radiation Oncology (befristet auf 4 Jahre mit Option zur Verlängerung) nach Vereinbarung zu besetzen.Die Universitätsklinik für Radio-Onkologie ist zusammen mit seinen Allianzpartnern einer der grössten Anbieter für Strahlentherapie in der Schweiz und ein zentraler Querschnittdienstleister des University Cancer Centers Inselspital UCI. Neben hochspezialisierten Angeboten deckt die Klinik eine vielfältige radio-onkologische Basisversorgung ab. Die Klinik betreibt umfassende Forschungsprogramme in den Bereichen Medizinphysik, Innovation und Technologie, Radiobiologie, klinische Forschung und Data Science.Um das Portfolio von Artificial Intelligence (AI) und Data Science zu stärken, wird in enger Zusammenarbeit mit dem ARTORG Center for Biomedical Engineering Research und dem Center for Artificial Intelligence in Medicine CAIM eine neue Professur geschaffen für “AI and Data Science in Radiation Oncology”.Der/die zukünftige Stelleninhaber:in weist einen hervorragenden Leistungsausweis in AI-Modellierung und Data Science mit Anwendungen im Bereich Onkologie, bevorzugt Radio-Onkologie auf. Erfahrungen im Bereich onkologischer Bildgebung sind von Vorteil. Grosser Wert wird auf erfolgreich durchgeführte translationale Projekte gelegt, idealerweise bis hin zur klinischen Anwendung. Von Vorteil sind Arbeiten zur Bedeutung von Datenqualität und Robustheit von AI-Modellen.Die Bewerbenden sollten über einen Doktortitel (PhD) in den Bereichen Informatik, Computational Science oder anderen verwandten Gebieten verfügen, mit mindestens 5 Jahre Erfahrung als Postdoktorand:in (Stufe Advanced PostDoc, bzw. Senior Researcher). Zudem sollten sie ein eigenständiges Forschungsprofil aufweisen, dieses schliesst den Aufbau einer international wettbewerbsfähigen Forschungsgruppe und die kompetitive Einwerbung von Drittmitteln ein.Von der Professur wird eine hohe Aktivität in der Nachwuchsförderung und Lehre erwartet. Zur erfolgreichen Bewältigung des Aufgabenspektrums sind neben der wissenschaftlichen Exzellenz ausgeprägte kommunikative Fähigkeiten unabdingbar. Die Stelle ist auf 4 Jahre befristet. Anschliessend erfolgt eine Evaluation und es besteht ggf. die Option auf Verlängerung.Die Universität Bern strebt eine Erhöhung des Anteils von Frauen in Professuren an und ermutigt daher ausdrücklich Frauen, sich zu bewerben. Die Universität Bern bietet vielfältige Angebote im Bereich der Vereinbarkeit von Arbeit und Familie/Partnerschaft an. Diese umfassen Kinderbetreuungsdienste, Angebote für Partner und die Möglichkeit des Jobsharings ( www.vereinbarkeit.unibe.ch ). Im Falle einer Jobsharing-Bewerbung, die grundsätzlich willkommen ist, sollten sich beide Kandidaten zusammen bewerben und ein gemeinsames Konzept vorlegen, in dem ihre vorgeschlagene Arbeitsvereinbarung und ihre gegenseitige Ergänzung dargelegt werden.Für weitere Informationen wenden Sie sich bitte an den Präsidenten des Wahlkommission, Prof. Marcel Egger, Geschäftsführender Direktor, Institut für Physiologie, Universität Bern, E-Mail: marcel.egger@unibe.ch.Bewerbungen Sind Bis 11. März 2024 Dem Dekanat Der Medizinischen Fakultät Der Universität Bern Ausschliesslich Elektronisch Einzureichen Über Diesen Linkhttps://www.recruiting.medizin.unibe.ch/positiondetails/8650755Für Bewerber:innen, die in die engere Auswahl kommen, wird am 25. April 2024 ein Symposium stattfinden. Bitte halten Sie sich diesen Termin frei.Weitere Angaben bezüglich verlangten Unterlagen finden Sie unter http://www.medizin.unibe.ch/dienstleistungen/rechtssammlung/professuren/index_ger.html#pane527037oder unter https://we.tl/t-TvUazlc7kWDekanat der Medizinischen Fakultät, Universität Bern, Murtenstrasse 11, CH-3008 BernRechtliche Hinweise

Ingénieur études et développement Fullstack JAVA/Angular (F/H) 🎯ASTRELYA est une société de conseil en IT basée à Paris et à Genève. Créée en 2018, aujourd'hui plus de 220 collaborateurs, accompagnent nos clients dans l’accélération et la transformation de leurs organisations.Dans le cadre de notre développement, nous recherchons un Développeur Fullstack Java/Angular F/H.Vos missions :Participer à l’analyse des besoins et à leur modélisationAider à l’estimation des efforts de développementDévelopper les User StoriesParticiper aux tests unitaires et d’intégrationParticiper à la mise en place des pipelines CI/CDEtre garant des bonnes pratiques et de la qualité du codeLes compétences recherchées :Très bonnes connaissances de JAVA (versions 8 et plus)Bonnes connaissances de Spring (SpringBoot, SpringCloud, SpringData...)Bonnes connaissance d'Angular (versions 2 et plus)Connaissances des architectures Microservices et des APIsConnaissances d'outils DevOps comme Gitlab, Jenkins,...Connaissance des méthodologies Agile (Scrum/Safe)Formation : Titre universitaire, ingénieur EPF, HES/ETS en informatique, ou équivalentExpériences : Minimum 5 ans d’expérienceLangues : Français courant et un bon niveau d'Anglais est attendu.Esprit analytique, force de proposition, très bonne communicationPourquoi rejoindre ASTRELYA ?Une gestion de carrière sur mesureUn accompagnement par un manager dédiéUne politique active de formations / certifications (technique, métier, leadership)Une offre variée de missions innovantes et ambitieusesDes primes de cooptation intéressantesL’accès à une plateforme digitalisée proposant des avantagesDes événements réguliersCette annonce vous correspond ? Are you passionate about creating real impact through AI technologies?We are. Come join our talented and driven team to shape our organization and the insurance industry at large.This is what you contributeAs a Backend Engineer, you will play a critical role in driving the development of our ML-based software solutions. As part of a cross-functional team with more than 20 highly motivated ML and Data Engineers, Developers, PO’s, Car Experts and other, you will design, implement, and maintain high-quality, production-ready software. You will be an integral member of the ML team, as well as working closely and collaboratively with the broader software development team.Here's how you'll make an impact:You analyze new software requirements for their feasibility and complexity.You develop the backend solutions using Python.You compile and analyze data, processes, and code to troubleshoot problems and identify areas for improvement.You define and develop the interfaces to the components (APIs) and the data models used by the systems.You maintain running systems in production, identify and fix bugs in them.Our tech stack includes:Frontend (React, TypeScript)Backend (NestJS, TypeScript, Postgres, TypeORM)Python and relevant computer vision libraries (e.g. NumPy, pandas, OpenCV, scikit-image)Large Language Models (e.g. GPT, LLAMA, BERT)Frameworks essential for training and evaluating image recognition tasks (e.g. PyTorch, Vertex AI, COCO)Databases (SQL, BigQuery)Infrastructure components such as GCP, GPU, Docker, GitHub Actions, Terraform, and CI/CDThis turns you into the perfect candidate3+ years of experience in software engineering, with a strong focus on Python and ideally with a BS/MS degree in computer science.You have experience with Infrastructure as Code and DevOps (implementing and maintaining CICD pipelines, deploying cloud infrastructure, code to testing, production environments, etc.).You enrich the team with your expertise in TypeScript and preferably with Node.js/NestJS.You have experience with Python web frameworks (FastAPI + Pydantic) as well as with Terraform.You are familiar with cloud services, and ideally with GCP.You are interested in Machine Learning and Computer Vision.You have good business acumen and ability to communicate technical matters to non-experts.You are proficient in English, German is a plus, and working in a startup spirit (all hands on deck / MVP thinking).Who needs your support?noimos is a Zurich-based, but globally focused, start-up harnessing the potential of ML, computer vision and design to shake up the insurance industry and revolutionize the all-important claims process.We are an independent subsidiary of one of the largest insurance groups in the world, AXA, enjoying many of the benefits that that brings.From a personal point of view, noimos is a small group of experienced professionals, with strong background Unser ROCKEN Partner ist spezialisiert auf die Beratung, Planung, Implementierung und den Betrieb von IT-Infrastrukturen. Dabei verwendet der Partner innovative und erprobte Technologien von weltweit führenden Herstellern und arbeitet mit bewährten Methoden, von denen Kunden ganzheitlich profitieren. Seit 2001 begleitet der ROCKEN Partner nationale und internationale Unternehmen bei ihren Herausforderungen in der IT. Dabei hilft der Partner mit Rat und Tat sowohl bei IT-strategischen Fragestellungen wie auch in der Umsetzung und der Betreuung der IT-Infrastruktur.Deine VerantwortungInstallation, Konfiguration und Wartung von Microsoft SCCM/MECM Servern.Betrieb, Weiterentwicklung und Wartung von Microsoft Kunden-Infrastrukturen in enger Zusammenarbeit mit dem Service Desk Team.Durchführung von Incident-, Change- und Problem-Management nach ITIL-Richtlinien (2nd/3rd Level).Automatisierung der Windows-Update-Verteilung mit ADR und MWI.Verwaltung von Defender/Endpoint Protection inklusive Konfiguration von Scans, Ausnahmen, Updates und Benachrichtigungen.Gelegentliche Paketierung, Updates und Verteilung von Applikationen.Umsetzung von Kundenprojekten wie Domänencontroller-Migrationen, Neuinstallationen von File-, Print- und Applikationsservern.Kontinuierlicher Wissensaustausch innerhalb des Teams sowie Erstellung von Konzepten und Dokumentationen.Deine SkillsDu hast erfolgreich eine IT-Ausbildung als Systemtechniker EFZ oder eine ähnliche Qualifikation abgeschlossen. Eine weiterführende Informatikausbildung auf HF/FH-Niveau wäre von Vorteil.Du besitzt umfangreiche Kenntnisse im Umgang mit Windows Servern ab Version 2016.Du verfügst über fundiertes Fachwissen im Bereich SCCM/MECM.Du bist erfahren im Umgang mit Active Directory, einschließlich Benutzerverwaltung, Gruppenrichtlinien und DNS.Du hast Erfahrung im Betrieb von Windows-Dateiservern und beherrschst Konzepte wie AGDLP (Accounts, Global Groups, Domain Local Groups, Permissions) und Access Based Enumeration (ABE).Du bist vertraut mit der Verwaltung von Windows Print Servern.Du besitzt Kenntnisse in PowerShell, die es dir ermöglichen, Automatisierungsaufgaben und Skripterstellung durchzuführen.Du verfügst über grundlegende Netzwerkkenntnisse, einschließlich des Verständnisses von Firewall-Policies und öffentlichen DNS-Konzepten.Deine Deutschkenntnisse sind fließend, und du verfügst über gute Englischkenntnisse.BenefitsGute Verkehrsanbindung und ErreichbarkeitHomeofficeZahlreiche MitarbeitereventsAttraktive MitarbeiterrabatteKostenlose Früchte und GetränkeAttraktive Weiterbildungs- und EntwicklungsmöglichkeitenKomfortables Büro mit moderner InfrastrukturOffene UnternehmenskulturInternationales UmfeldCoaching und MentoringROCKEN Jobs:https://rocken.jobsProfil erstellen:https://rocken.jobs/application/profil-erstellen/

Minimum qualifications:Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.Candidates will typically have 8 years of experience in software development, and with data structures/algorithms.Typically 5 years of experience testing, and launching software products, and 3 years of experience with software design and architecture.Typically 5 years of experience with machine learning algorithms and tools (e.g., TensorFlow), artificial intelligence, deep learning, or natural language processing. Experience coding in C++ or Python.Preferred qualifications:Master’s degree or PhD in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical field.Experience with Natural Language Processing.Experience with machine learning, generative AI, or similar fields.About The JobGoogle's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.As a Staff Software Engineer, you will strengthen our effort to match user queries with ads that satisfy the underlying user intent with helpful options. Such ads provide advertisers with growth opportunities and users with new perspectives. You will develop AI models that capture relations beyond simple semantics and provide a rich opportunity for innovation and impact.Google Ads is helping power the open internet with the best technology that connects and creates value for people, publishers, advertisers, and Google. We’re made up of multiple teams, building Google’s Advertising products including search, display, shopping, travel and video advertising, as well as analytics. Our teams create trusted experiences between people and businesses with useful ads. We help grow businesses of all sizes from small businesses, to large brands, to YouTube creators, with effective advertiser tools that deliver measurable results. We also enable Google to engage with customers at scale.ResponsibilitiesDefine the criteria for expanded user query and ad relations.Work with Google Research and identify AI/ML innovations to model the expanded relations beyond semantics.Lead model training, evaluation, and deployment with a small group of junior Software Engineers.Influence and shape the expanded match technology direction and plans, and drive the implementation progress through fast exploration cycles.Explore new architectures, augment existing training data, find better evaluation methods and feedback signals, and identify headroom opportunities.Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Zudem setzt sie auf Nachhaltigkeit und implementiert laufend Massnahmen für eine grüne IT.Deine VerantwortungEs bereitet dir Freude, Kunden zu kontaktieren und sie für die Private & Public Cloud Lösungen zu begeistern.Du übernimmst die Verantwortung dafür, dass sämtliche Windows Server Systeme stets mit den neuesten Security Patches und Features ausgestattet sind (Patchmanagement).Durch deine Verantwortung für die Erstellung und Pflege von Softwarepaketen für das zentrale Software Deployment spielst du eine entscheidende Rolle für reibungslose Abläufe.Durch deine Scans und Reports behältst du jederzeit den Überblick über die Infrastruktur und trägst so wesentlich zu einem stabilen Betrieb bei.Es liegt in deinem Verantwortungsbereich, Konzepte zu entwickeln, einschliesslich Machbarkeitsstudien, und bestehende "On-Premises" Management Tools in die Azure Cloud zu transformieren.Deine SkillsDu verfügst über ausgewiesene Berufserfahrung bezüglich Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager (MECM) respektive System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM) und hast Erfahrungen mit entsprechenden PaaS-Diensten in der Azure Cloud.Du kannst stolz auf deine mehrjährige Erfahrung im Bereich VMware in einem Enterprise- und/oder Provider-Umfeld zurückblicken.Proaktiv informierst du dich über sicherheitsrelevante Updates und implementierst diese bei Bedarf auf Ebene Virtualisierung und Server-Betriebssystem.Du hast Freude am Scripten und Automatisieren, beispielsweise mit Hilfe von PowerShell.Motiviert, kontinuierlich zu lernen und als gleichberechtigtes Mitglied eines leistungsstarken Teams zu arbeiten, bist du.Du kommunizierst sowohl auf Deutsch als auch auf Englisch. Deine VerantwortungDu sorgst für die Systemverfügbarkeit und -sicherheit, indem du regelmässige Überprüfungen und Updates durchführst.Du betreust die virtuellen Server in einer VMware ESX Umgebung und gewährleistest ihre reibungslose Funktion.Du kümmerst dich um die virtuellen Arbeitsplätze in einer Citrix VDI Umgebung und stellst sicher, dass sie den Anforderungen der Nutzer entsprechen.Du planst und führst eigenverantwortlich IT-Infrastrukturprojekte durch, um die Effizienz und Leistungsfähigkeit der Systeme zu verbessern.Die Administration der M365 Produktreihe, einschliesslich Exchange Online, liegt ebenfalls in deinem Verantwortungsbereich, um die Kommunikation und Zusammenarbeit im Unternehmen zu unterstützen.Des Weiteren stehst du als 2nd Level Anwendersupport bereit, um bei technischen Problemen zu helfen und sicherzustellen, dass die Mitarbeiter effektiv arbeiten können.Deine SkillsDu verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Berufsausbildung in einem ICT-Beruf. Du bringst mehrere Jahre Berufserfahrung in einer ähnlichen Position mit, um die Anforderungen der Stelle erfolgreich zu erfüllen. Do you find it rewarding to identify and eliminate system bottlenecks to achieve the best possible performance on pioneering computer hardware? Could you be thrilled about an opportunity to partner with the developer community, working at the forefront of technology breakthroughs that contribute to the success of an industry leader like NVIDIA? job_description:
Wir sind die Innovatoren im Herzen der Payment Technologie und beeinflussen, wie die Welt ihre Zahlungen abwickelt. Die Lösungen, die unsere Mitarbeiter/innen schaffen, unterstützen das Wachstum der Geschäfte von morgen. Vom lokalen Kaffeehaus bis internationalen Banken, von San Francisco bis Auckland. Wir sind in jeder Ecke der Welt und in jedem Teil des Handels vertreten. Und so, wie wir unsere Kunden unterstützen, ihr Geschäft voranzutreiben, so engagieren wir uns auch dafür, dass unsere Mitarbeiter/innen ihren Karriereweg gehen. Gemeinsam gestalten wir den Fortschritt.Die MöglichkeitWir suchen einen engagierten DevOps Engineer für unsere Fraud Detection Software, der in einem vielseitigen Team von Spezialisten für Third-Party-Applikationen im Kartengeschäft tätig wird. In dieser Position werden Sie integraler Bestandteil unseres DevOps Teams für die Fraud Detection Software sein. Dabei stehen Sie nicht nur im ständigen Austausch mit Kunden, externen Systemen und Lieferanten, sondern eignen sich auch ein umfassendes Verständnis für das Geschäftsfeld der Fraud Detection an.Ihre Verantwortlichkeiten umfassen das Betreiben und Integrieren von Applikationen, einschließlich der Fraud Detection, in unseren Linux-, Windows-, MySQL- und Oracle-Umgebungen. Sie entwickeln und automatisieren Deployments und Funktionstests, koordinieren, überprüfen und implementieren Releases, um einen reibungslosen Betrieb sicherzustellen. Neben dem Pikettdienst sind Sie aktiv in die Einbindung von Kunden, Lieferanten, Umsystemen und Stakeholdern eingebunden. Dies ermöglicht Ihnen einen tiefen Einblick in das Geschäftsfeld der Fraud Detection mit allen Umsystemen.Tägliche VerantwortlichkeitenSicherstellung des IT-Betriebs der Fraud Detection SoftwareDurchführung von Wartung und Releases in enger Abstimmung mit allen StakeholdernWeiterentwicklung und Aufbau von AutomatisierungenMitarbeit in ProjektenBetreuung der Kunden in technischen BelangenUnterhalt und Erweiterung der Überwachungs- und Automatisierungsfunktionen2nd-Level-Applikationssupport für zugewiesene Applikationen, einschließlich Pikettdienst und sporadische WochenendeinsätzeSystemintegration neuer Applikationen in die ProduktionsumgebungSicherstellung des Betriebs von Dienstleistungen, die von externen Software-Lieferanten entwickelt wurdenWen wir suchenTechnischer oder Informatik-Lehrabschluss oder höhere Ausbildung in Informatik (FH oder Uni)Fundierte Kenntnisse im Linux-Umfeld mit entsprechenden Zertifikaten sowie Erfahrung in Integration, Betrieb und Überwachung von DienstleistungenFundierte Kenntnisse in SQL, Oracle, Shell-/Perl-Scripting sowie NetzwerkkommunikationKundenorientierte und selbstständige ArbeitsweiseAnalytisches und vernetztes DenkenFlexibler, kreativer und pragmatischer TeamplayerSehr gute Deutsch- und EnglischkenntnissePerks & BenefitsMobile Working innerhalb der Schweiz und flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle Unterstützung des ÖV-Abonnements Nutzung des eigenen Personalrestaurants Umfassende Weiterbildungsprogramme Zusatzangebote für Familien Mögliche Teilnahme am Innovation Festival @ Worldline Mitarbeiterbeteiligungsprogramm: Wir gewinnen gemeinsam als Team, und unsere langfristigen Anreizpläne sind so konzipiert, dass jede Worldline einen finanziellen Anteil an dem Unternehmen erhält, zu dessen Wachstum sie beiträgt Nachhaltige, internationale Firmenkultur Shape the evolutionWir sind auf einer spannenden Reise in der Payment Industrie und suchen proaktive Menschen, die einen positiven Wandel vorantreiben können, Themen aktiv angehen und aufzeigen, was als Nächstes ansteht und dazu beitragen, die Organisation weiterzubringen. Bei Worldline werden Sie mit zielstrebigen Kolleginnen und Kollegen aus der ganzen Welt zusammenarbeiten, um als Team einzigartige Herausforderungen zu meistern und einen Einfluss auf die Gesellschaft zu haben. Mit einer ermutigenden Firmenkultur, starker Technologie und einem breitem Trainingsangebot werden wir Sie unterstützen, Ihre Karriere voranzutreiben. Kommen Sie in unser Team mit über 18.000 Mitarbeitenden weltweilt und formen Sie die Zukunft mit, denn es ist auch Ihre.Lerne mehr über Worldline auf careers.worldline.comWir sind stolz darauf ein Arbeitgeber zu sein der Gleichberechtigung wertschätzt. Wir diskriminieren niemanden aus Grund von Religion, Hautfarbe, Geburtsort, Sexualität, gesundheitlichen Voraussetzung, Geschlechtsidentität, Alter, Behinderung oder anderer Charakteristiken.

Across the data center industry – from deployment, through operations and maintenance, to decommissioning – Salute Mission Critical is the industry leader of delivering global data center services executed with precision. Join us as a Data Center Engineer in Zurich, Switzerland.At Salute, we don’t have employees. We have team members. It’s our culture, and it’s a significant driver of the success we're able to deliver for our clients. This team-oriented culture is defined by transparent communication, collaborative development and deployment of procedures and best practices, a customer service mindset both internally and externally, and a strong commitment to safety.The Data Center Engineer is responsible for ensuring that all electrical, mechanical, and fire/life safety equipment within the data center is operating at peak efficiency. This involves both planned preventative maintenance of equipment, daily corrective work, and emergency response to emergent issues. The Data Center Engineer serves as a technical resource reporting to the Data Center Site Manager and third party vendors. Data center equipment that supports mission-critical servers must maintain better than 99.999% uptime. This equipment includes, but is not limited to, standby diesel generators, switchgear, UPSs, PDUs, AHUs, chillers, cooling towers, chemical treatment systems, pumps, motors, VFDs, and building automation systems.RequirementsOperate, monitor, maintain, and respond to abnormal conditions in facilities systemsComplete planned and ad-hoc preventive maintenance work assignments requiring the skill and direction of several engineering, mechanical, and maintenance tradesConduct periodic inspections of building systems, i.e., HVAC, electrical distribution, Maintain mechanical equipment rooms to ensure clean and safe conditionsRapid response, investigation, and management of indoor emergency situations and air quality complaintsHave a complete working knowledge on creating, closing and tracking "work requests" (WR). Initiate or respond to work orders, follow-up and verify completion of workUse of customer ticketing systems and relevant processes e.g., change requests.Monitor performance/note deficiencies of service contractors and recommend changes as necessaryPerform other related duties and responsibilities as assigned by managementWork within a on call rotation during outside normal business hours and be able to respond to incidents while on callDraft and review operational documents such as SOPs, MOPs, EOPsPerform site walks and checks as requiredPerform minimal IT/customer related tasks as requiredQualificationsA minimum of 2 years of directly related experience in the operation, installation and maintenance of data center critical equipment, building systems with in-depth technical understanding and knowledge of all HVAC, electrical, plumbing, fire/life safety, and control systemsHigh school diploma or College DegreeKnowledge of the electrical and mechanical systems used in a data center environment, including: Feeders, Transformers, Generators, Switchgear, UPS systems, ATS/STS units, PDU/PMM units, Chillers, Air handling units, CRAC units and building management systems (BMS)Good observation skills and problem-solving abilityGood verbal and written communication skills in German and EnglishElectrical or mechanical qualificationAbility to write and review operational documents such as SOPs, MOPs, EOPsThe role is a full-time position and based in Zurich, Switzerland, and will include business travel as needed to meet business demands but will likely be nominal.If your professional growth and compensation trajectory are restricted in any way, consider –Stepping into a role with a internationally recognized leader in the Mission Critical marketWorking with an employer who maintains a corporate philosophy to hire only the bestWho invests in and are unilaterally committed to continuing the enrichment of their employeesIf you have what it takes to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment we welcome the opportunity to provide more detail and explore your current situation and interests.

job_title: Senior Cybersecurity Analyst - Requires relocation to Barcelona
job_description:
Company DescriptionWhy are we here?Eurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company, providing a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries, to make life and our environment safer, healthier and more sustainable. From the food you eat, to the water you drink, to the medicines you rely on, Eurofins laboratories work with the biggest companies in the world to ensure the products they supply are safe, their ingredients are authentic, and labelling is accurate.Eurofins is dedicated to delivering testing services that contribute to the health and safety of society and the planet, and to its corporate responsibility to protect the environment and ensure diversity, equity, and inclusion across the entire network of Eurofins companies.Job DescriptionAre you looking to relocate? The position in based in Barcelona, Spain!In a nutshellAs a Senior Cybersecurity Analyst you will enhance the technical aspects of IT Risk Assessments on a central, regional, and local level, providing valuable recommendations to our Business Leaders. In addition to your primary focus, you'll have the opportunity to engage in various projects such as Phishing campaigns and IT Risk Resilience tests as part of your daily responsibilities.This role will require the person to be able to travel extensively easily throughout Europe up to 35% to 40% of the time. Where will you be based and what business will you support?Joining one of our teams in Barcelona - the Group Assets and Risks department- you will be at the forefront of managing risks associated with IT Management, Infrastructure, Operations, Development, Cyber, and Information Security activities in the EMEA region.How can you help us?Your primary area of expertise will be to contribute to central and local IT Risk Assessments and provide recommendations to the Business Leaders by:Independently design, plan, and execute technical aspects of IT risk work programmes for specific areas under evaluation. Execute technical components of risk and audit assessment, at all levels of the Eurofins’ Organisation: Central Services, Regional Infrastructure, Laboratories within the assigned region. Propose relevant technical recommendations to enhance Eurofins´ process control, and risk mitigation. Articulate results verbally in a clear, professional, and problem-solving manner. Produce clear and high-quality reports to formally communicate results to management. Follow up on the implementation of agreed action plans to mitigate identified IT risk. Maintaining professional relationship with internal stakeholders and partners (IT and business). QualificationsAre you our kind of extraordinary?Personal skills:This position requires an independent and structured candidate with self-confidence and negotiation skills, with an ability to challenge established processes and effectively manage multiple priorities and ambiguity in a rapidly moving business environment. Strong Emotional Intelligence with demonstrated leadership in a large organization involving multiple stakeholders. Excellent written and verbal communication skills are a must. The ability to convey information security and risk-related concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences in English is essential. International profile, open to frequent travels within their region.  Technical Skills:3 - 5 years’ experience in performing technical roles in cybersecurity and/or in related IT Control Functions in an international company. Broad experience with technical assessments of cloud-based environments. Broad knowledge and understanding of industry best practice, and emerging trends for security configurations in the most known Operating Systems (Windows/Linux) and Cloud environment. A strong technical background in cybersecurity and very good understanding of IT technology to ensure the achievement of business outcomes where the business process is dependent on technology. Ability to provide input to data and security requirements for complex IT and business environments. Broad technical understanding of network infrastructure design, firewalls, IDS/IPS, SIEM/SOAR. Ideally knowledge/experience in UK/EU Data Protection Regulations, NIS2 Directive and other relevant regulations. CISSP, CompTIA Network´+ or any other recognised Information Security qualifications. Education and/or Experience:Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Business or other relevant field. Additional InformationWhat can we offer you?A competitive salary package, including bonus and benefits;Extensive on-the-job coaching and training opportunities;Challenges within a multi-cultural and cross-regional team as part of the international and fast-growing Eurofins organization;A dynamic working environment with a good team spirit where personal development and growth are highly encouraged. Your application:As the role and Eurofins' IT Talent Acquisition team are international, please ensure to submit your application in English.Want to know more about us?We support your development! Do you feel you don’t match 100% of the requirements? Don’t hesitate to apply anyway! Eurofins companies are committed to supporting your career development.We embrace diversity! Eurofins network of companies believe in strength and innovation through diversity, being an Equal Opportunity Employer. We prohibit discrimination against employees or applications based on gender identity and/or expression, race, nationality, age, religion, sexual orientation, disability, and everything else that makes employees of Eurofins companies unique.Sustainability matters to us! We are well on our way to achieving our objective of carbon neutrality by 2025, through a combination of emission reduction and compensation initiatives. We encourage our laboratory leaders to make sustainable changes at their local level, and in addition to their initiatives we also count on our dedicated carbon reduction team to help us to achieve this goal!Find out more in our career page: https://careers.eurofins.com/Company description: Eurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company, providing a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries, to make life and our environment safer, healthier and more sustainable. From the food you eat, to the water you drink, to the medicines you rely on, Eurofins laboratories work with the biggest companies in the world to ensure the products they supply are safe, their ingredients are authentic and labelling is accurate.The Eurofins network of companies is the global leader in food, environment, pharmaceutical and cosmetic product testing and in discovery pharmacology, forensics, advanced material sciences and agroscience contract research services. It is one of the market leaders in certain testing and laboratory services for genomics, discovery pharmacology, forensics, advanced material sciences and in the support of clinical studies, as well as having an emerging global presence in Contract Development and Manufacturing Organisations. It also has a rapidly developing presence in highly specialised and molecular clinical diagnostic testing and in-vitro diagnostic products.In over 35 years, Eurofins has grown from one laboratory in Nantes, France to 61,000 staff across a decentralised and entrepreneurial network of ca. 900 laboratories in 61 countries. Eurofins companies offer a portfolio of over 200,000 analytical methods to evaluate the safety, identity, composition, authenticity, origin, traceability and purity of biological substances and products.In 2022, Eurofins generated total revenues of EUR 6.7 billion, and has been among the best performing stocks in Europe over the past 20 years.

Fondé en 2011, Squad est un cabinet de conseil et d’expertise, TOP7 français des spécialistes de la cybersécurité. SQUAD est une société de conviction technique qui a très tôt identifié une convergence entre la cybersécurité et les métiers de l'infrastructure, du Cloud et du développement. Forts de notre savoir-faire et de la qualité technique de nos experts, notre ambition est de construire le leader européen de la Cybersécurité et du DevSecOps. Nous avons 800 experts répartis dans 11 agences en France et sommes présents en Suisse ainsi qu’au Canada. Nous accompagnons les plus grands­ comptes clients dans de nombreux secteurs : marché public, bancaire ainsi que l’industrie du luxe et horlogerie. De plus, connectés avec les enjeux d’aujourd’hui, nous nous engageons pour répondre aux défis actuels :· Développer les compétences de nos experts grâce à des outils de formations en accès libres et des préparations aux passages des meilleures certifications techniques,· Veiller à l’équilibre vie pro-perso en restant à l’écoute des squadiens, un engagement symbolisé par notre note de 4.6/5 sur Glassdoor. Dans le cadre de la croissance de notre agence Suisse, nous recherchons un ingénieur DevSecOps H/F. Responsabilités :Développer et mettre en place des outils et des processus de sécurité dans le cadre du développement et du déploiement continue de logiciels,Intégrer la sécurité dans les différentes phases du cycle de vie du développement applicatif ou logiciel (planification, développement, test et déploiement).Collaborer avec les équipes de développement et d'exploitation pour identifier les vulnérabilités et les menaces potentielles et mettre en place les mesures nécessaires pour y remédier avec nos clients,Automatiser les tâches de sécurité pour accélérer les tests et les déploiements.Surveiller les systèmes et les applications en production pour détecter les intrusions, les vulnérabilités et les incidents de sécurité.Évaluer et sélectionner les outils de sécurité appropriés pour répondre aux besoins spécifiques de nos clients. Compétences requises :Diplômé(e) d’un niveau master en grande école d’ingénieur. Une spécialisation en infrastructure et/ou en développement est un plus,Vous participez à la définition et mets en œuvre les process, les mesures et outils de DevSecOpsVous accompagnez en proximité les développeurs de la plateforme dans leur montée en compétences et autonomisation DevSecOps et dans l’intégration des outils de contrôles sécurité dans leur CI/CDVous définissez, mettez en œuvre et maintienez un tableau de bord DevSecOpsVous surveillez les indicateurs sécurité SI et investigue les alertesVous pilotez le traitement et la résolution des incidents / vulnérabilités de sécurité SI conjointement avec les équipes de dév. Vous assurez une veille sécurité SI pour l’ensemble de la plateformeVous préparez et animez un comité mensuel de sécurité opérationnelle SI avec les produits La maitrise de l’anglais est obligatoire. Intégrer SQUAD Switzerland, c’est : Bénéficier d’un accompagnement personnalisé de la SquadeXpérience dans votre évolution de carrière. Nos experts vous accompagnent dans la construction de votre parcours de formations en ciblant les formations et les certifications pour atteindre vos objectifs en lien avec votre métier.Développer votre expertise et votre prise de parole en animant des MixYourTalent (webinairs), en participant à nos sessions CTF chaque mois (HackTheBox), en rédigeant des articles techniques publiés sur notre blog #TheExpert et autres évènements techniques organisés en interne.Participer aux meilleurs Tech Event et évènements de références afin de représenter Squad, de porter haut nos couleurs et d’assister aux conférences d’experts reconnus afin de développer votre veille technologique (FIC, DevCon, LeHack, European Cyber Week )Devenir un expert et référent auprès de nos candidats, intervenir auprès de nos écoles partenaires et la possibilité de contribuer aux soutenances à appels d’offres, Et surtout beaucoup de fun et de convivialité (#SquadParty, #MeetYourBoss, #TeamSpirit, #DéjeunerEnEquipe, #Soirée Gaming, #Soirées OSINT, #Sessions CTF)Envie d’en savoir plus ? Postulez dès à présent, nous serons ravis de vous rencontrer !

This role is a unique opportunity to play an integral part in shaping global IT infrastructure projects, aligning them with the company's strategic direction.Key Responsibilities: * Designing, administering, and ensuring optimal performance of IT infrastructure components. * Managing and enhancing Microsoft Tenant, including Active Directory and Office 365. * Resolving infrastructure issues efficiently, prioritizing optimal operation and risk mitigation. * Overseeing storage and backup management, ensuring data is protected through robust backup, archival, and restore processes. * Harnessing Microsoft Azure and Office 365 to implement new features and optimize cloud solutions. * Leading patch management, application deployment, and Windows updates using tools such as Intune, Autopilot, MECM, and others.Profile  * In-depth knowledge of Exchange (on-premises & cloud), Active Directory, Microsoft 365 & Azure products. * Proficiency with Windows Servers / clients and deployment tools  * Solid understanding of storage solutions, Hypervisor systems, and backup platforms . * Working knowledge of network components, including switching/routing and firewalls. * Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field. * 7 -10 years of relevant professional experience. * Experience working on international projects and fluency in both French and English. * Independently motivated, flexible, resilient, proactive, and customer-centric with excellent problem-solving and communication skills.

Date de début : dès que possibleConditions requises : Autorisation de travail en Suisse ou résidence en SuisseLieu de travail : Lausanne, Suisse - sur siteEnova Group a été créé à Genève et fournis des services informatiques en Suisse depuis 2018.Enova Consulting est une société de conseil spécialisée dans la stratégie numérique, laperformance opérationnelle et les technologies de l'information au départ. Nos activités sont axées sur les compétences IT les plus demandées par les entreprises et le management de projets de bout en bout.Maintenant nous pouvons proposer et adapter des offres orientées sur d’autres domaines d’activités tel que l’ingénierie, la pharmaceutique, mais avant tout nous avons une maitrise des sujets autour de l’intelligence artificielle et de la data science par exemple grâce à Enova Data.Basé à Genève et Zurich, notre approche holistique et notre expertise nous permettentd'accompagner nos clients dans la réalisation de leurs projets. Nous entretenons despartenariats forts avec nos clients et avec nos experts hautement qualifiés, dans une poursuite de l'excellence.En tant que Test Analyst BPMN (Business Process Model and Notation), vous serez responsable de la planification, de la conception et de l'exécution de tests pour les processus métier modélisés en BPMN. Vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans l'assurance de la qualité des processus métier au sein de notre organisation. Vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec les équipes de développement, les analystes métier et les responsables de projet pour garantir que les processus métier fonctionnent de manière optimale et conformément aux exigences spécifiées.Vos missionsVotre RôleDéfinition du concept de test basé sur la stratégie de Concevoir des plans de test détaillés en fonction des modèles BPMN, des spécifications des processus et des exigences métier.Créer des cas de test et des scripts de test en utilisant les meilleures pratiques en matière de test pour évaluer la conformité des processus métier.Effectuer des tests fonctionnels, de performance, de régression, et d'acceptation sur les processus Documenter et suivre les défauts identifiés, en assurant leur résolution Collaborer avec les parties prenantes pour clarifier les exigences et les spécifications des processus métier.Préparer les scénarios de test en vue de l’automatisation pour notre équipe d’automaticien lorsque cela est possible et pertinent.Fournir des rapports et des analyses sur l'état des tests et les résultats aux parties prenantes du Contribuer à l'amélioration continue des processus de test et des processus métier en identifiant les opportunités d'optimisation.Vos compétencesVos QualificationsVous êtes titulaire d'une formation d'ingénieur en informatique ou de type généraliste et vous pouvez prévaloir d'au moins 3 ans d'expérience avérée en gestion des données de test, de préférence dans un environnement de développement Vous maitrisez le français et vous faites preuve d'une bonne connaissance orale et écrite en anglais (niveau B2 minimum) Vous êtes certifié ISTQB Vous maîtrisez Jira et Jira Xray Connaissance approfondie des processus de test logiciel et des différentes phases du cycle de vie du développement. Excellentes compétences en communication, en particulier pour expliquer des concepts techniques à des personnes non techniques. Capacité à travailler en équipe et à collaborer avec des membres d'équipes De nature proactive, vous challengez les solutions et proposez des solutions dynamiques et innovantes Sont un plus : Expérience professionnelle démontrée en tant que Test Analyst, avec une spécialisation dans le domaine BPMN Connaissance Guidewire AvantagesCe que nous offrons :Possibilité de télétravail : 1 à 2 jours en moyenne5 semaines de vacancesLe processus de recrutement :Enova propose un processus de recrutement qui est en général en 4 temps:Un premier entretien en vidéo conférence par TEAMS pour faire connaissance: en apprendre plus sur votre parcours et vos compétences. C’est aussi un moment de partage ou nous vous présenterons Enova et ses activités.Si vous êtes shortlisté vous pouvez aller en second entretien avec en général le manager du compte client ou bien un autre collaborateur de Enova, soit à distance par TEAMS soit dans nos locaux en face2face.Une fois les premières informations et étapes passées nous organisons une rencontrer et/ou un entretien technique avec les équipes techniques du clientSi nous nous projetons ensemble sur une collaboration nous vous présenterons durant un 3ème entretien, idéalement en physique, le contrat de travail que nous vous proposons.Durant ce processus, nous communiquerons aussi bien par téléphone que par email et nous pourrions vous inviter également à rencontrer nos équipes dans nos locaux ou bien les équipes de notre client bien entendu.Pour les postes techniques nous attirons votre attention sur l'importance d'un test technique en ligne pour évaluer votre niveau notamment sur les langages de programmation par exemple.Vous vous demandez encore pourquoi vous devriez postuler ?Vous travaillerez aux côtés d'experts en utilisant les technologies les plus modernes.Un management de proximité pour établir un lien d'équipe fort avec Enova !Vos activités quotidiennes seront intéressantes, stimulantes et variées.Aucun jour ne ressemblera à un autre !

job_description:
As a leading provider of AI-powered extended managed detection and response (MXDR) services, Ontinue is on a mission to be the most trusted, 24/7, always-on security partner that empowers customers to embrace the future by using AI to operate more strategically, at scale, and with less risk. We believe that the combination of AI and human expertise is essential for delivering effective managed security that is tailored to a customer’s unique environment, operational constraints, and risks.Our MXDR service combines powerful proprietary AI with a one-of-a-kind collaboration model to continuously build a deep understanding of our customers’ environments, informing how we prevent, detect, and respond to threats. Our unrivaled Microsoft expertise allows customers to achieve these outcomes with the Microsoft Security tools they already own. The result is highly localized managed protection that empowers security teams to be faster, smarter, and more cost efficient than ever before.Continuous protection. AI-powered Nonstop SecOps. That’s Ontinue.Your MissionJoin our enthusiastic feature team of engineers and face the challenge to bring the threat detection and response platform to the next level. As an Azure Cloud Developer in the Managed Detection and Response team, you will use your knowledge and experience to build modern solutions on the Azure platform. Design, Develop and support Cloud-Native applications and API development using NET, NET Core and Containers in AzureInvolved in implementing highly scalable solutionsDesign Integration Architecture that is scalable, fault tolerant and meets service SLAs/SLOs.Review code and design from other team members and provide constructive feedbackContribute to improving the security posture of our Cloud PlatformResolve escalated incidents related to our CI/CD tools and Azure platformBuild and provide observability support for Azure platform solutionsRequired SkillsExperience in implementing integration using queues and topicsExperience in Event driven architecture leveraging high throughput, real-time stream processing toolsExperience with developing application integrations on Azure Platform using Azure Web Apps, Logic Apps, Azure Functions, Azure Durable Functions, API management, Services Bus, Event Grid, Rest API’s, Cosmos/PostgreSQL etc..Full ability to design, write, test, and release code in general-purpose languages such as .Net, .Net Core, C#, Typescript. Experience in developing REST APIs using .NET Core Framework is a must.Develop cloud native solutions using REST APIs and other microservices.Strong experience in designing APIs using standards such as SwaggerExperience in API Lifecycle, API Management and GovernanceUnderstanding of API and Micro Services ArchitectureFlexibility and willingness to carry out different roles, can work independently, self-motivated and problem solver.Flexibility on working with teams with different time zones.Experience developing proactive monitoring and alerting capabilities for the different components of the platform.Experience with monitoring and responding to alerts and issues with ability to be on call as needed.University degree in Information Security or Computer Science.Working experience in designing and developing Integration solutions using Azure Integration services such as Azure APIM, Logic Apps, App Services, Event HubMultiple years of experience working with CI/CD solutions (preferably based on GitHub actions, ArgoCD, Artifactory).Bonus SkillsExperience with AWS Cloud.Certified Microsoft Azure DeveloperUnderstanding of GraphQL, Event Driven Architecture Schemas, API metadata and discovery with Swagger.Knowledge of Go, Python, Golang.Experience with Microsoft Active Directory and Azure AD.Has good understanding of tools like Azure DevOps, GitHub Enterprise, Docker, Kubernetes.Possesses familiarity with configuration management across a multi-platform estate such as Ansible, Puppet, Terraform, or ARM Templates.Experience working with backstage.io as a developer portal.Experience working with mono repo and trunk based development.What We OfferWe have been recognized as a top place to work! In addition to a competitive salary, we also offer great benefits and access to management and Microsoft training.Come as you are! We search for amazing people of diverse backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives. Ontinue welcomes and encourages diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, disability, or veteran status.Next StepsIf you have the skills and experience required and feel that Ontinue is a place you can belong, we would love to get to know you better! Please drop an application to this role and our talent acquisition manager will be in touch to discuss further.Learn more: www.ontinue.com.

Er sieht seine Mitarbeiter als wertvollen Teil des Unternehmens, Ihr aktives Mitdenken und Mitgestalten wird dort geschätzt.
