Job Reference #289116BRJob TypeFull TimeYour roleDo you have the know-how to apply business analysis techniques to deliver IT projects in an agile environment?Do you want to use your expertise to help our projects succeed?We’re looking for a IT business analyst to: engage with colleagues at all levels to meet business requirements translate business requirements into technical documentation collaborate with technologists to drive delivery within an Agile framework conduct as-is and to-be impact analysis contribute to reduction of all security and operational risks, in line with policies and standards identify opportunities to improve our processesYour teamYou’ll be working in the Client Data Confidentiality Enabling Architecture (CDC EA) POD as part of the Client Service Data Crew in Zürich. We provide Client Static Data on a need to know basis to applications all over the bank. As a Business Analyst you will play an important role in creating value for our clients and support the requirements process E2E in collaboration with our costumers, stakeholders and POD team.Our international and supportive team is looking forward to meet you and benefit from your skills, ideas and spirit.Your expertise ideally experienced in the SCRUM delivery model within the financial sector solid understanding and experience of SDLC great affinity for databases and understanding database models as our application is a provisioning service proficient in using data visualization, analytics and documentation tools like Visio, Tableau or Power BI, SharePoint and Confluence technical experience with tools like TOAD for DB2, GitLab, SOAPUI for rest API and webservices testing is a plus structured and independent way of working very strong analytical skills yet always understanding the big picture inquisitive, able to challenge effectively and manage conflicting stakeholder needs excellent written and verbal communication skills fluent in EnglishAbout UsUBS is the world’s largest and the only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors..We have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries.Join usAt UBS, we embrace flexible ways of working when the role permits. We offer different working arrangements like part-time, job-sharing and hybrid (office and home) working. Our purpose-led culture and global infrastructure help us connect, collaborate, and work together in agile ways to meet all our business needs.From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we’re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?Disclaimer / Policy StatementsUBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.Your Career ComebackWe are open to applications from career returners. Find out more about our program on ubs.com/careercomeback.

Veeam®, the #1 global market leader in data protection and ransomware recovery, is on a mission to empower every organization to achieve radical resilience through data security, data recovery, and data freedom for their hybrid cloud.Headquartered in Columbus, Ohio, with offices in more than 30 countries, Veeam protects over 450,000 customers worldwide, who trust Veeam to keep their businesses running.At Veeam, Senior System Engineers work closely with our Sales Teams and help to evangelize our product offerings to our customers, and partners.  These positions require significant travel within the region of responsibility. To excel in this role, Systems Engineers need to have strong technical knowledge and expertise in the relevant industry. They also need to possess excellent communication and presentation skills to effectively convey complex technical information to non-technical individuals. Additionally, problem-solving behavior and analytical skills are essential to identify and address customer needs and challenges.  We are looking for a self-starter who drives business opportunities in a proactive manner and acts as a trusted advisor in the ecosystem. Your tasks will include:Work with sales to help secure and grow business with new and existing end-user customers, Cloud and Hosting Providers Provide web-based and on-site demonstrations of Veeam product portfolio including training, enablement, joint meetings Provide pre-sales support and/or on-site assistance to customers as they evaluate Veeam software Together with sales colleagues build and maintain relationships with customers and strategic alliance partners Provide input for and participate in Veeam marketing events Conduct Product POCs (Proof of Concept) to customers Prepare the B.O.M, RFPs/ RFQs depending on the exact need of the customers Demonstrate new technologies & train internal staff/customers Work independently or work with the team in identifying and qualifying business opportunities Provide Technical compliance and competitive analysis of products that are part of the solution Hands-On experience in Hypervisors and Cloud environments Coordinate presales efforts with customers, through the help and collaboration of Veeam Solution Architects, System Integrators, and Professional Services figures (regardless if they are Veeam colleagues or via Partners) What we expect from you:Ability to drive business conversations with relevant stakeholders like C-Level at the customers Can advise customer decisions on their future business strategy, and have the ability to ensure total customer experience on assigned accounts Have excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and FrenchComfortable in presenting to groups, both remotely and in-person 50% travel expected across the Switzerland A self-starter with the ability to learn new technologies quickly Client interaction for requirement gathering and understanding existing infrastructure Knowledge in VMware and Microsoft virtualization technologies in large environments Knowledge and experience of Microsoft Azure, AWS; be comfortable to position and engage discussion around Cloud technologies Will be an advantage:VMCE certification would be an advantage - employees can obtain VMCE and VMCA once they have started the job. Knowledge in Kubernetes technologies platforms is an advantage We offer:Modern, energetic working environment Opportunities for professional growth and promotion Salary ranges depending on skills and expertise Flexible working hours and home office/hybrid mode  Veeam Care Days – additional 24 hours for your volunteering activities Professional training and education, including courses and conferences, internal meetups, and unlimited access to online libraries (Bookster, Percipio, Athena LMS, O’Reilly)Please note: If the applicant is permanently located outside of Switzerland, Veeam reserves the right to decline the application for the position. Remote work is only possible for employees located in Switzerland.Veeam Software is an equal opportunity employer and does not tolerate discrimination in any form on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, veteran status or any other classification protected by federal, state or local law. All your information will be kept confidential.Please note that any personal data collected from you during the recruitment process will be processed in accordance with our Recruiting Privacy Notice.The Privacy Notice sets out the basis on which the personal data collected from you, or that you provide to us, will be processed by us in connection with our recruitment processes.By applying for this position, you consent to the processing of your personal data in accordance with our Recruiting Privacy Notice.

job_title: Data Scientist / ML Research scientist internship H2.24 (100%)
job_description:
About SpidenWhat could you build on top of real-time and non-invasive Glucose monitoring? That is what Spiden is all about, and we want to beat Apple at it:https://www.handelsblatt.com/unternehmen/industrie/start-up-check-schweizer-start-up-spiden-will-apple-bei-blutzucker-technik-ueberholen/29293274.htmlMachine learning, personalized health, and predictive medicine. If these areas resonate with you, join us to work on foundational technologic and scientific challenges at Spiden. We are a Swiss MedTech venture with the vision to use state-of-the-art detection techniques to continuously monitor and learn from a wide range of vital indicators, to better manage chronic diseases, to customize critical treatments and, to improve your health.Your missionUsing proprietary optical sensors, Spiden is building a cutting-edge biomedical data generation pipeline to train medical-grade Machine Learning algorithms to infer glucose transcutaneously from spectral measurements. To achieve our vision, our team and advisory board consist of world experts coming from top academic institutions (ETH, EPFL, Columbia, Princeton, or Harvard among others) and industry leaders (Baxter, Roche, Lonza). We are looking for a talented, experienced, voraciously curious, and self-driven professional with great opportunities for growth.ResponsibilitiesAs a Data Scientist or Machine Learning Research Intern, under the support of experienced Senior ML scientists, you will work first hand with rich experimental data ranging from biomedical to biophotonics domain. You will be involved in research of state-of-the-art ML models that involve large-scale and multi-modal data processing.In this role, you will be part of the Machine Learning Research & Engineering team working closely with all RnD teams, including Biomedical Science, Biophotonics, Integrated photonic and Electrical Engineering.Your profileQualificationsLast year student or recently completed Master's degree in Computer Science, Physics, Math, Statistics or a related technical field (such as Biomedical engineering or Electrical engineering) with direct ML exposure.Demonstrable experience (during studies or personal projects) in writing software on Python primarily, alternatively C, C++, Java, or similar.High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities, being comfortable in a dynamic and sometimes ambiguous environment.Demonstrable interest in research bundled with the capacity to digest scientific literature effectively Excellent communication skills Desirable Experience with scientific analysis packages such as NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, Scikit-learnExperience with ML frameworks such as PyTorch primarily, or TensorflowExposure (during studies or personal projects) to the Google Cloud Platform or another public cloud platform would be a plusIMPORTANT: we cannot sponsor working permits for non-EU / EFTA nationals for this role. Applications that do not fulfill this criteria will be automatically rejected.We offerWork/Life BalanceWorking at a growing MedTech start-up is demanding and our goals are ambitious, which is why our team puts a strong emphasis on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. Therefore, we offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal life.Values and Mission are important at Spiden, as the ultimate goal is to improve people's well-being and we aspire to live that. We will have the chance to discuss value and mission during the interview process.DiversityWith 18 nationalities in the company, we strive to build a diverse and exciting environment. Within the SMLE team we take special care of gender diversity - currently balanced at 50/50 among the permanent employees- and equal opportunities.Mentorship & Career GrowthOur team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We want you to grow with Spiden.Amazing team!In this role, you will be part of the Machine Learning Research & Engineering team, currently composed by 13 awesome colleagues from which you will have the opportunity to learn a lot professionally, but also enjoy great conversations and fresh and well informed points of view. Additionally, you will be working closely with all RnD teams, including Biomedical Science, Biochemistry, Biophotonics, and Electrical Engineering.Don't forget to check the team page on our website!Our recruitment processThe interview process consists of 3 stages:Introduction call (20 min - led by hiring manager - remote with video)Technical Interview (60-90min - led by engineers from the team - remote with video)On-site interview (90 - 120 min - Culture & Team fit, Lab tour, if role requires meet members from other teams - in person in our office and lab in Pfäffikon)About UsWe encourage you to apply even if you do not believe you meet every single qualification.Not all strong candidates will meet every single requirement as listed. We know that underrepresented groups more often doubt the strength of their candidacy, but we urge you not to exclude yourself prematurely and to still submit an application if you're excited about this work and think your profile is overall a good fit!We believe that products like the ones we’re building will have an impact on a very broad set of people, and we strive to include a range of diverse perspectives on our team. We would love to hear from you!The company:Spiden is a Swiss medtech venture with the vision to use state-of-the-art detection techniques to continuously monitor and learn from a wide range of vital medical indicators, allowing to improve your individual health.

job_title: Software Engineer - Mixed Reality and AI
job_description:
The Microsoft Mixed Reality & AI lab in Zurich, Switzerland, is a research and development team building the future of Mixed Reality and AI. The lab is near ETH Zurich, the top technical school in continental Europe, enabling close collaboration in multiple areas. The city of Zurich is a hub for innovation. Known for its exceptional quality of life, Zurich consistently ranks among the top cities in the world.Our lab is focused on using computer vision, machine learning/AI and cloud computing to map and understand the environment, recognize, and track relevant objects, and assist users in performing their tasks with ease. We are looking for talented front and backend software engineers who share our passion for creating innovative technology that can be deployed to the cloud and utilized by millions of users.As a member of our team, you will work with experts in software engineering, computer vision, graphics, machine learning, robotics, and human computer interaction. Collaboration is essential to our work. We work as a team to create the best possible technology. Join us and grow your career with us.ResponsibilitiesWork within a team to develop and improve services and products, understanding user requirements, and contribute to design and coding. Support and enhance software architecture, with a focus on frontend and/or backend development. Collaborate to develop detailed plans for testing and quality assurance of solutions. Take part in defining and reviewing development aspects: selecting technologies, refining workflows, and enhancing coding practices. Implement automation and tooling to streamline processes and enhance accuracy in repetitive tasks. Introduce innovative technologies to our production support tool chain, minimizing friction in production releases and support. Contribute to the operations of live services, gaining valuable hands-on experience. QualificationsRequired Qualifications:Computer Science or Engineering degree, or similar experience. Demonstrated skills in software and system engineering with practical experience in at least one of these areas: C++, C#, Python, DevOps, or cloud computing. Excellent communication skills in English, both spoken and written, and teamwork abilities. Preferred QualificationsExperience in one of the following topics: iOS and/or Android development. Typescript and/or web development. Unity/MRTK/ARKit/ARCore app development. Experience with cloud technologies such as Kubernetes, relational/document databases, gRPC/protobuf, batch/stream processing, etc. Experience with operating scalable build systems and CI/CD pipelines. The ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to, the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

job_description:
Join our client Alcon, a leading company in ophthalmology, for an exciting opportunity to contribute to their materials management and finance departments:Business Analyst Materials Management and FinanceStart: ASAPEnd Date: 1+ year Extension: Individual based on performanceWorkload: 100% Location: SchaffhausenDepartment: Materials Management Flexible modelRoles & Responsibilities:Provide support to the Head of Materials Management and Head of Finance in day-to-day business operations.Utilize data analysis techniques to identify improvement opportunities in areas such as inventory management, write-offs, purchase price variances, and master data accuracy.Take ownership of driving small projects and improvement initiatives aimed at enhancing materials management and finance processes.Assist in the budgeting process and contribute to product costing activities.Qualifications:Bachelor's degree, ideally with a major in finance or controlling.Demonstrated strong analytical ability, with the capacity to extract insights from complex datasets.Proactive and solutions-oriented mindset, capable of independently identifying and addressing challenges.Proficiency in ERP systems for data management and analysis.Advanced skills in MS Office, particularly Excel.Advantageous to have previous relevant work experience in planning or finance roles.Languages:Fluency in both German and English.We look forward to receiving your complete application documents in PDF format.

job_title: Enzymology and DDI Research Associate - 5736 VGI
job_description:
The Life Science Career NetworkCTC are specialised industry experts who can help companies source the best talent and provide reliable HR and consulting services, support varied candidates in finding promising career opportunities and offer the latest in skill development training programmes.Our client is a pioneer in Drug Discovery and Development and is among the frontrunners in Personalised Healthcare. As the world's largest R&D spender in the pharmaceutical and diagnostics domain, they work across a vast array of drug discovery and therapeutic areas, enjoying high international recognition.For their headquarters in Basel, Switzerland, we are currently seeking a:Enzymology and DDI Research AssociateThis is a 12-month contract position with the possibility of extension. Focused primarily on small molecule projects, we are seeking a motivated candidate to address gaps in the ADME field for drug development. The position entails advancing in vitro assay techniques to estimate fractions metabolized by enzymes to support clinical PK prediction and drug-drug interaction (DDI) risk assessment for small molecule portfolios.Responsibilities:Conduct laboratory-based assays in in vitro enzymology/DDI and allied experimental areas of small molecule drug metabolism, such as incubating test substances using hepatocytes, human liver microsomes, and recombinant enzymes.Analyze incubation samples via LC-MS/MS and radio-HPLC, including bioanalytical method development and/or validation.Plan, monitor, communicate, and report enzymology/DDI studies in both drug discovery and drug development settings, reporting to laboratory staff and supervisors.Perform rigorous verification and develop best practices to improve regular enzymology/DDI assays where current approaches are inadequate.Some time may be spent supporting the development of new enzyme phenotyping methodologies and approaches with the help of automation.Requirements:BSc or MSc degree in chemistry, biochemistry, pharmacokinetics, or equivalent discipline with an interest in drug metabolism, pharmacokinetics (DMPK), and pharmacodynamics (PD). (Recent PhDs might be considered—please note that this is a laboratory-focused position.)Good knowledge of metabolic enzyme biochemistry (e.g., CYP450, UGT), hands-on/experimental enzyme kinetics assessment, and respective experimental designs.Experience in bioanalytical method development/validation for radio-HPLC (e.g., Thermo®) and LC-MS/MS (e.g., Sciex®). This includes troubleshooting and data analysis (e.g., using Analyst® software).Would you like to learn more about CTC and the opportunity outlined? Please contact us either by using the 'apply now' button or by sending an email to vanessa.gilardoni@ctcresourcing.com.

Join SIX Group AG, a leader in the financial services industry. We are seeking for a motivated, talented and experienced System Engineer who is passionate about innovation and automation to enhance our Messaging Platform.You will be part of an international team that develops and maintains the messaging platform (IBM MQ and Kafka) for multiple lines of business. Your main responsibility will be engineering and operating this platform, but a significant portion of your role will also involve automating processes and enhancing our self-service processes. To excel in this role, you should have a background in managing platforms with a strong passion for automation and enjoy working collaboratively in an Agile team. You should possess experience and knowledge in common messaging patterns. You will be expected to drive and enforce standardization, simplification, and scalability by taking on responsibilities as a DevOps engineer, challenging the status quo, and introducing new ideas and solutions. Your expertise in Kubernetes will be crucial for SIX and the team to efficiently engineer and deploy our self-service portal and automation platform in a fully automated manner.    What You Will Do develop and maintain our messaging platform (IBM MQ) to support various business linesimplement and manage CI/CD pipelines and modern development workflows using infrastructure as codemaintain and migrate existing pipelines in Jenkins to a modern architecture stackemploy advanced scripting and programming skills in languages for effective platform automationengage in system design and architecture, especially for distributed systems in large-scale environmentsdrive disaster recovery planning and execute capacity planning strategies for future scalabilityparticipate in on-call rotations, ensuring system reliability and rapid incident response   What You Bring  proficiency in containerization technologies such as Kubernetes/OpenShift and Infrastructure as Code using tools like GitLab and Jenkinsstrong skills in programming and configuration management tools (e.g. Ansible).strong background in monitoring tools like Prometheus for efficient system oversight.semonstrated experience in network protocols (TCP/IP, HTTP), network security, and firewall configurations.understanding of messaging concepts (incl. hardware appliances)communicative team-player with good self-management capabilitiesa proactive attitude and the ability to take initiative in identifying and resolving issuesproficient with English both verbal and in writing

Wer wir sind?Wir sind ERNI. Seit 1994 beraten und unterstützen wir Unternehmen in Innovation und Technologie mit dem Ziel, die unternehmerische Leistungsfähigkeit unserer Kunden zu steigern und damit den Weg ins digitale Morgen zu ebnen. Unser Schlüssel zum Erfolg: Menschen wie Du. Und unser von schweizerischen Werten geprägter Mindset. Wir wollen, dass unsere Kunden effektiver und innovativer sind als alle anderen. Gemeinsam erreichen wir diese hochgesteckten Ziele. Partnerschaftlich. Als echtes Team. Und mit echten Werten.Auf diese Weise gestalten wir Prozesse so einfach und smart wie möglich – mit rund 800 Mitarbeitenden an 18 Standorten in 8 Ländern. Und vielleicht schon bald auch mit Dir!Was Dich erwartet:Du bist der Katalysator für die Projekte unserer Kunden. Mit Business Analyse und Requirements Engineering-Methoden unterstützt Du die Optimierung von Businessprozessen und leitest Handlungsbedarf für IT-Applikationen ab. Zusätzlich führst Du mit dem Kunden Workshops durch, um Produktanforderungen (Portfolio, System, Produkte etc.) zu erfassen, zu überarbeiten und die Auswirkungen auf Weiterentwicklungen von Produkten zu beurteilen. Dabei sind agile Vorgehensweisen ein fester Bestandteil Deines Repertoires. Idealerweise bist Du sogar stolzer Besitzer eines entsprechenden Zertifikats. Was Du mitbringst:Neben einem Hochschulabschluss (Uni, FH, HF) in einem technischen Bereich (Elektro, Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik) kannst Du bereits praktische Erfahrung als Requirements Engineer vorweisen und beherrschst verschiedene Requirements-Elicitation- und Dokumentations-Methodiken. Optimalerweise besitzt Du sogar ein IREB Foundation Level Zertifikat.Das medizinaltechnische Feld ist Deine Spielwiese. Und komplexe Systeme Dein Spielzeug. Du begeisterst Dich für deren Entwicklung und kannst es nicht erwarten, gleichzeitig Herr oder Frau über Hardware-, Elektronik-, und Software-Komponenten zu sein. Im Idealfall hast Du in einem dieser Bereiche sogar schon Erfahrungen gesammelt. Dasselbe gilt für die Anwendung von BPMN – eine Zertifizierung als Certified Expert in Business Process Management OCEB macht Dich zum perfekten Neuzugang für unser Team. Du bist mobil und mit Deiner Kommunikation und Deinem Teamgeist bringst Du vielfältige Projekte bei den unterschiedlichsten Kunden zum Erfolg. Die deutsche Sprache beherrschst Du verhandlungssicher in Wort und Schrift, jedoch beeindruckst Du auch mit guten Englischkenntnissen.Deshalb bieten wir Dir:Flexible ArbeitszeitenPersönliches EntwicklungsprogrammSmartphone-PauschaleMobilitätszuschussTeam- und Company-Events, die wirklich Spass machen!Weiterbildung und CoachingsKlingt genau nach dem, was Du suchst?

with industry standards and product requirements.You drive initiatives to continuously improve the performance, functionality and usability of smart lighting products.Side Tasks:Initiation and monitoring of PCB production runs.Analysis and evaluation of telemetry data from products in the field.Provide training on processes and products to the extended internal team.Keeping abreast of industry trends, new technologies and best practices in hardware and firmware development to drive innovation and maintain a competitive advantage.RequirementsMust Have'sBachelor's or Master's degree systems, hardware circuits and firmware for consumer electronics or IoT devices.Proficiency in programming languages such as C/C++, Python for embedded systems.Strong understanding of hardware design principles, PCB layout, signal integrity and power management.Experience with microcontroller/microprocessor-based systems, wireless communication protocols (e.g. Bluetooth Low Energy, Zigbee, attention to detail and ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.Highly independent, systematic and analytical approach to work.Excellent English language skills and good knowledge of German.Nice to Have'sNetwork in the hardware sector (sensors / electronics / production).Experience with global supply chains.Linux operating system knowledge.BenefitsAt LEDCity you are not just a small wheel in a big machine, you are an important and highly valued individual. At LEDCity you work towards the bigger goal together - your success is our success and vice versa.Time for yourself - enjoy 6 weeks of holiday per year.Innovative start-up environment where you can actively work towards a more sustainable future.International, young, and dynamic team of talented people who have made their passion into their profession.You can grow with us - there are many career opportunities in a fast-growing start-up.Work in a central location in Zurich or the possibility to work from home.As much coffee and tea as you can drink and fresh fruit.Fun and team building - every second Friday there is Funday Friday with changing activities like going for a drink, ping-pong, barbecue, games etc.Have we sparked your interest? job_title: Research Scientist Intern, Computer Vision and Machine Learning (PhD)
job_description:
The Reality Labs org aims to connect people from all over the world through world-class AR/VR hardware and software. Our XR Scene team explores, develops, and delivers new cutting-edge technologies that serve as the foundation of current and future Meta products. Specifically, our engineering and research topics cover broad Scene Understanding and Rendering from core perception technology Depth Inference, Semantic Segmentation, Semantic Keypoint to end-to-end features on Passthrough, Occlusion, Room Layout Estimation, and 3D Object Detection. Our team is focused on taking new technologies from early concept to the product level while iterating, prototyping, and realizing the developer and user value and related new experiences.Our internships are twelve (12) to twenty-four (24) weeks long and we have various start dates throughout the year.Research Scientist Intern, Computer Vision and Machine Learning (PhD) Responsibilities:Participate in cutting-edge Computer Vision & Machine Learning research and development for VR/AR/MR related topicsDevelop technology that will be part of mass-market shipping consumer productsDocument and present research progress and aim to publish findings at high-impact CV/ML conferencesMinimum Qualifications:Currently in the process of obtaining a PhD degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or Electrical and Computer Engineering in the field of computer vision, machine learning, computer graphics, or robotics3+ years experience with Python and/or C++2+ years experience with modern deep learning frameworks like PyTorchKnowledge in Computer Vision, in one or more of the following domains: Scene Understanding (3D Object Detection, Semantic Segmentation, Semantic Keypoints, Room Layout Estimation), Monocular/Stereo Depth Estimation, Multi-View Geometry (e.g. Structure-from-Motion, Multi-View Stereo, SLAM), Semi / Weekly / Self-supervised Machine Learning, Computational Geometry)Excellent interpersonal skills, cross-group and cross-culture collaborationAbility to communicate complex research in a clear, precise, and actionable mannerMust obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employmentIntent to return to a degree-program after the completion of the internship/co-opPreferred Qualifications:Proven track record of achieving significant results as demonstrated by publications in top computer vision conferences (e.g., CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, or, SIGGRAPH) or journals (e.g., IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence, International Journal of Computer Vision, Pattern Recognition, or IEEE Transactions on Image Processing)Demonstrated software engineering experience via an internship, work experience, coding competitions, open source contributions, or researchAbout Meta:Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Wenn Sie auf der Suche nach einer neuen Herausforderung sind und bereit sind, Ihr Fachwissen einzubringen, dann sind Sie hier genau richtig.Automatiker / Software-Ingenieur (m/w/d) 100%Die HerausforderungVerantwortlich für die Erstellung umfassender Dokumentationen, einschließlich Programm-Beschreibungen und Bedienungsanleitungen, mit Fokus auf lückenloser Datensicherung und Archivierung.Programmieren der Steuerungssoftware der Maschinen, sowohl für Siemens als auch Allen Bradley SPS-SystemeProgrammierung der Visualisierungs- und Überwachungssoftware mit Siemens/zenon HMI/PVSErstellen von Validierungsunterlagen wie Funktionsspezifikationen, Hardware-Design-Spezifikationen, Software-Design-Spezifikationen und Installation/Operation-Qualification-DokumentationenWeltweite Inbetriebnahme von Maschinen und AnlagenBearbeitung und Betreuung von zugewiesenen Entwicklungsaufgaben zur kontinuierlichen Verbesserung der ProdukteBereitstellung von MSR-Listen und Schemata für interne und externe KundenPräsentationen, Schulungen und Überarbeitungen bei Kunden sowie auf Wunsch Betreuung von Auszubildenden im Bereich AutomatisierungstechnikUnterstützung von Mitarbeitern und Kunden durch Bereitstellung von FachwissenDein ProfilAbgeschlossene Ausbildung in Elektrotechnik oder Mechanik mit einer Weiterbildung zum Software- oder Automationsingenieur/-technikerErfahrung in der Programmierung von Siemens S7/Allen Bradley SPS-Steuerungen, Prozessvisualisierungssystemen wie zenon von Copa-Data und Siemens Comfort HMIs sowie verschiedenen Feldbus-SystemenKenntnisse in Mess-, Steuerungs- und Regelungstechnik sowie ElektrotechnikGrundkenntnisse in den Bereichen ATEX oder GAMP sind von VorteilBereitschaft zu Reisetätigkeiten (ca. 10 - 20%)Sehr gute Englischkenntnisse.Bereitschaft zur kontinuierlichen WeiterentwicklungWenn Sie bereit sind, Ihr Können einem globalen Kundenstamm zugänglich zu machen und Teil eines dynamischen Teams zu werden, dann zögern Sie nicht länger. Bewerben Sie sich noch heute und sichern Sie sich die Chance, an spannenden Projekten mitzuwirken und die Zukunft der Automatisierungstechnik mitzugestalten.Nutzen Sie diese Gelegenheit und bewerben Sie sich jetzt! Werden Sie Teil unseres Teams und bringen Sie Ihr Talent in die Realisierung herausragender Projekte ein.Um eine bestmögliche und zeitnahe Bearbeitung zu gewährleisten, bitten wir Sie sich ausschliesslich via den Button „Auf Stelle bewerben“ zu bewerben.Wir sind die Triebfeder, wenn es um erfolgreiche Personalgewinnung geht.Weil die richtigen Mitarbeiter schwer zu finden sind, aber das richtige Personal unternehmerischer Erfolg bedeutet, bringen wir seit 35 Jahren Menschen in der Schweizer Arbeitswelt zusammen.

Rattaché au secteur Informatique (TCIT) du centre de prestations Marché du travail/assurance-chômage, le groupe Services Infrastructures IT est responsable de l'exploitation économique et sûre de toutes les infrastructures informatiques internes (exploitation de systèmes OnPremise des applications stratégiques clés) et externes (Supply/Demand) du service public de l'emploi, du paiement des prestations d'assurance, de l'entrepôt de données/datawarehouse (environnement BI et BI-Reporting), ainsi que des solutions de portail (eGovernment) dans les domaines PLAN, BUILD et RUNVos tâchesMembre du conseil d'architecture IT et du conseil de sécurité IT – participation à l'élaboration de la stratégie TIC. Max Friedli, chef du groupe Services Infrastructures IT : max.friedli@seco.admin.ch.Veuillez postuler via notre système de gestion des candidatures. Pour ce faire, veuillez cliquer sur «Pour postuler».Numéro de référence: JRQ$540-9392À propos de nousLe Secrétariat d'État à l'économie (SECO) est le centre de compétences de la Confédération pour toutes les questions relatives à la politique économique et au marché du travail. Il est rattaché au Département fédéral de l'économie, de la formation et de la recherche (DEFR). Il contribue à l'ouverture de tous les marchés aux biens, services et investissements. Le SECO intervient dans le domaine de la coopération économique au développement en vue de réduire la pauvreté. Il planifie les mesures économiques et commerciales en faveur des pays en développement, des pays d'Europe de l'Est et d'Asie centrale ainsi que des nouveaux États membres de l'Union européenne (UE).L'administration fédérale est attentive aux différents parcours de vie et besoins de ses collaboratrices et collaborateurs et en favorise la diversité. Elle accorde la plus haute priorité à l'égalité de traitement.Les personnes francophones et italophones étant sous-représentées dans notre unité administrative, nous nous réjouissons de recevoir leur candidature.

job_title: Software Engineer - Mixed Reality and AI
job_description:
The Microsoft Mixed Reality & AI lab in Zurich, Switzerland, is a research and development team building the future of Mixed Reality and AI. The lab is near ETH Zurich, the top technical school in continental Europe, enabling close collaboration in multiple areas. The city of Zurich is a hub for innovation. Known for its exceptional quality of life, Zurich consistently ranks among the top cities in the world.Our lab is focused on using computer vision, machine learning/AI and cloud computing to map and understand the environment, recognize, and track relevant objects, and assist users in performing their tasks with ease. We are looking for talented front and backend software engineers who share our passion for creating innovative technology that can be deployed to the cloud and utilized by millions of users.As a member of our team, you will work with experts in software engineering, computer vision, graphics, machine learning, robotics, and human computer interaction. Collaboration is essential to our work. We work as a team to create the best possible technology. Join us and grow your career with us.ResponsibilitiesWork within a team to develop and improve services and products, understanding user requirements, and contribute to design and coding. Support and enhance software architecture, with a focus on frontend and/or backend development. Collaborate to develop detailed plans for testing and quality assurance of solutions. Take part in defining and reviewing development aspects: selecting technologies, refining workflows, and enhancing coding practices. Implement automation and tooling to streamline processes and enhance accuracy in repetitive tasks. Introduce innovative technologies to our production support tool chain, minimizing friction in production releases and support. Contribute to the operations of live services, gaining valuable hands-on experience. QualificationsRequired Qualifications:Computer Science or Engineering degree, or similar experience. Demonstrated skills in software and system engineering with practical experience in at least one of these areas: C++, C#, Python, DevOps, or cloud computing. Excellent communication skills in English, both spoken and written, and teamwork abilities. Preferred QualificationsExperience in one of the following topics: iOS and/or Android development. Typescript and/or web development. Unity/MRTK/ARKit/ARCore app development. Experience with cloud technologies such as Kubernetes, relational/document databases, gRPC/protobuf, batch/stream processing, etc. Experience with operating scalable build systems and CI/CD pipelines. The ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to, the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

This is a part-time position, salary range is 50-70USD/hour.Please go read our documentation in Notion for more information about the company, this position and the take-home project: vuengineering[dot]notion[dot]site**VU Engineering is a bootstrapped company that is trying to solve the visual inspection process in manufacturing through digitalization and automation.We are a small, distributed team working asynchronously and are looking for people who:are result-oriented, proactive and pragmaticstrive for simplicity and clarityare good communicators (we write a lot!)are system thinkersdefault to transparencyOur recruitment process is as follows:Show, don’t tell: Small take-home project (4-6 hours): https://github.com/vuengineering/hiring/tree/main/software-engineeringQ&A+alignment call: This will be an occasion for us to virtually meet, discuss the assignment and reply to your questions1 month paid trial contract: you will be working on a real project with us for a month (on an hourly contract basis). This will allow seeing if it’s a good fit technically and culturallyOfferTasksExamples of some of your tasksimplement new API endpoints in our Django backenddatabase optimizationimplement new UI features in our React frontendautomate our machine learning pipelinefix our continuous integration pipelinesetup a cache for our backend in Azurecreate documentationA typical day at VUEngineeringtake time to update everyone on important progress/statuscode review, merge opened PRsif possible pick an existing issue ready for implementation in the GitHub backlog marked for the next release, code, open PR, make changes/comments based on feedback, ship!if working on an issue not yet ready for implementation, create a document in notion explaining the context, different approaches with their pros and cons, etc… Basically a brainstorming meeting in written form, request review from someone else, iterate until issue is ready for implementationif you see things that could be improved (in the product, our CICD stack, documentation, etc…), open an issue in the backlog or post a message on Slackalign and ask a lot of questions!RequirementsOur stackbackend: Django (Python)+ PostgreSQL (for relational data) + Blob/object storage (for image data)frontend: React (Typescript)ML: PyTorch+MLflow (Python)Other Toolsversion control, CICD, task management: GitHubdocumentation: notion (internal) + static site (user-facing)internal communication: Slackexternal communication: emailWhat We Expect Of YouDo’swork whenever and wherever you want, we care only about resultsask questionsbe proactivewhen in doubt, clarifykeep it simpleDont’swait for guidance (instead, ask for it)jump to implementation (instead, seek to understand first)work in your corner for days on end (instead, volunteer updates and status on your work)BenefitsWe are a small team distributed on different time-zones. We strive to work as asynchronously as possible and have as few meetings as possible.We are only interested in results so you can work however, whenever and wherever you want. If you need time off or holidays, you are free to take it with very minimal process. You will also have very high autonomy and agency and will be empowered to contribute directly to many aspects of the company.More information about the company, this position and our hiring process in our Notion: vuengineering[dot]notion[dot]site.

job_description:
We are actively seeking a talented technical Oracle Finance Support Business Analyst, Swiss or EU member fluent in English, enthusiastic about being a key partner for all Finance and IT stakeholders. This hybrid position is based in Zurich-Regensdorf, where you will join the Finance team approximately 3 days per week. Notably, this new role offers excellent opportunities for someone ambitious and ready to make a substantial impact.As a part of X-Rite Pantone, you will be responsible is to serve as the Oracle expert, based in Regensdorf ( Zürich) for the Global Finance team, collaborating closely with finance partners to document requirements, create functional designs, and monitor project progress. You are a part of the Global IT Oracle team reporting to the US-based Oracle Support Manager.You inherently excel as a networker, both internally and externally, at all levels. Engaging on both local and global scales, you will act as the Oracle expert, assuming responsibility and providing guidance for global processes. Additionally, you will involve pre-release testing and collaborating with the worldwide enterprise team to secure support for optimizing business processes, significantly contributing to operational excellence and innovation.Join us and shape the future of Oracle Finance! You responsibilitiesWork with business partners to understand and document their business processes, issues, challenges, and opportunities.Document precise requirements, prepare functional design documents, monitor project progress, and test solutions before release to users for further user testing.Work with the global enterprise team to get the necessary support or solutions to support business processes.Provide short-term, mid-term, and long-term solutions to business issues.Coordinate testing with end users.Prepare training materials and provide user training for new processes.Maintain appropriate documentation.Ensure adequate support for Oracle solutions.Use Oracle Support to research new functionality, troubleshoot problems, and escalate into Service Requests as needed.Identify improvements to be made to existing solutions and processes.Ensure proper application management practices are in place.Provide customer service to the assigned business groups and meet escalated operational needs.Provide hands-on troubleshooting and support when required.Hands-on experience in ticketing and change management tools like Jira, Alloy, etc.Utilize VES, participate in daily management meetings, adhere to standard work, and work with the team to continuously improve the process.relavant experience as an Oracle Business Analyst or similar role, supporting the Oracle financials modules using Oracle’s E-Business Suite (EBS) or Oracle Cloud.Demonstrated solid understanding of business processes; prior business-level experience a plus.Demonstrated ability to improve procedures and standards, ensuring quality and service delivery to customers.Demonstrated ability to document precise business requirements and solutions needed to meet business requirements and to translate the requirements into functional designs for Oracle, 3rd party add-ons, extensions, and interfaces. Experience with Oracle AIM or OUM methodology preferred.Demonstrated ability to perform effective prioritization with limited resources and drive results with a high emphasis on quality.Solid understanding of best practices in ERP usage and ability to bring a consulting approach to help the business solve issues and challenges.Proven experience working with Oracle Support to investigate, research, recommend, and test Oracle EBS patches.Demonstrated Problem Management and Root Cause Analysis skills.Demonstrated ability to build trust and relationships with business users and leaders.Technical skills are a plus, including writing SQL and PL/SQL queries using TOAD, EBS Workflow Administrator, and XML Publisher.University Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Finance, Business Administration, or the equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.Excellent verbal, active listening, and written communication skills and demonstrated facilitation skills.English language spoken and written fluency required; second language proficiency preferred.Keen attention to detail; solid organizational and time management skills.Ability to travel for global deployment and support.Preferred QualificationGood Understanding of EMEA LocalizationGood Knowledge of European VATPrior experience in manufacturing industryX-Rite/Pantone is a global leader in color science and technology. We are the outstanding supplier of color systems and develop, manufacture, distribute and support innovative color management solutions based on measurement systems, software, color standards and services. Our customers are mainly packaging and commercial printers, plastic, textile and automotive manufacturers, producers of various types of paints and their suppliers.At Veralto, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.If you’ve ever wondered what’s within you, there’s no better time to find out.At Veralto, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.If you’ve ever wondered what’s within you, there’s no better time to find out.

job_description:
Ringier Data Technology Department is looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our team. Our team leverages the latest NLP models to create recommendation systems, do sentiment analysis or extract entities from text and many more NLP applications. We're also working with cutting-edge technologies, like LLMs, trying to create applications that will drastically increase the visibility of Ringier's brands.Your tasksYou choose, improve, and apply various methods from statistics, machine and deep learning technologies in order to solve business problemsYou model the data of our users, their interests and online behavior in order to serve the business demands, and enable the future business modelsYou work closely with our data engineering team and other cross-functional teams to develop prototypes for cross-portfolio use cases, and support the deployment of your models or algorithms into the cloud-native production environmentYou communicate and visualize the value of data by describing the findings or the way how techniques work to both technical and non-technical audiencesYou keep closely following research and engineering developments mostly in the NLP field, like HuggingFace, LLMs roll in the relevant technologies and methodologies to keep our modern technology landscape up to dateYour profileYou have a degree (MS, Ph.D.) in computer science, statistics, mathematics or a comparable degree program or equivalent work experienceYou have a strong record in applying Machine Learning to real-world datasets in a productive environment, you are familiar with the main ML frameworks (TensorFlow, Torch, XGBoost, LightGBM, ...) and have strong experience in PythonYou have deep knowledge of the latest advances in the NLP domainYou have worked with time-series and know the basic concepts and methodologies for time-series forecastingYou have experience in software development and are confident with developing the full ML model lifecycle from research to production ensuring aspects such as reproducibility and scalability (git, dvc, Docker, Kubernetes, TensorFlow Serving, Amazon Web Services)Experience on recommender systems is a plusYou're a team player and at the same time can be independent and take responsibility of your tasksRecruiting ProcessAfter checking your documents, there will be a short call for initial clarifications and to make an appointmentThis is followed by a technical interview with Elena Adamantidou, Lead Data Science (duration approx. 45 to 60 minutes)The next step is a small task which you will have to complete in a weekThe final interview will be on-site with the entire team to discuss, among others, the above taskIn case you are the best candidate, HR will contact you with an offerDo you feel addressed? Then we look forward to receiving your application.We show our colours and are convinced that diversity is an opportunity. Everyone (*all) should be exactly who they are. We create a working environment in which this is possible.For this position we only consider direct applications.Ringier AGRingier is a Swiss media and technology company. The Group comprises around140 companies in *20* countries, which operate a range of leading mediabrands, digital platforms, and marketplaces. Almost 80 percent of theoperating profit comes from the digital business. This makes Ringier one ofthe leading media companies in Europe. The family business has been basedon entrepreneurship, cooperation, innovation, trust and courage for 190years.

Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Totogi. Have you got what it takes?Are you an AI/ML maverick ready to disrupt the telecommunications industry? We are looking for someone who eats, sleeps, and breathes AI technologies, with a fierce determination to redefine the game.It’s no secret that the multibillion-dollar telco industry is ready to be disrupted, and Totogi’s cutting-edge software and open APIs are what’s making the industry’s dinosaurs nervous. We have developed the world’s only AWS-native, SaaS monetization platform for the industry. Telcos use our platform to meter all of their data and voice calls, generating tremendous volumes of engagement data. We’re expanding the AI team responsible for generating the unique and valuable insights that only we can provide to our global customers to optimize revenue and slow attrition. We need an experienced industry veteran like you to help lead the charge.In this role, you will leverage structured data directly from our charging engine, fostering rapid innovation on AWS infrastructure. This unique approach offers unparalleled opportunities to experiment with cutting-edge tools and impact the telecom sector's evolution. job_title: Contractor for ADME – enzymology and DD
job_description:
I am working with a leading pharmaceutical firm have a great opportunity for the right candidate to join on an initial 12-month contract role onsite in Switzerland.Job Responsibilities:Conduct the laboratory-based assays in in vitro enzymology/DDI and allied experimental areas of small molecule drug metabolism as e.g. incubation of test substances using hepatocytes, human liver microsomes, recombinant enzymes.Analyzing incubation samples via LC-MS/MS and radio-HPLC, including bioanalytical method development and/or validation.Plan, monitor, communicate and report enzymology/DDI studies both in a drug discovery and drug development setting reporting to the respective laboratory staff and supervisors.Perform rigorous verification and develop best practices to improve the regular enzymology/DDI assays where current approaches are inadequate.This contract will be based in Basel. Our client is offering an hourly rate of 95 CHF.Requirements:You have a BSc or MSc degree in chemistry, biochemistry, pharmacokinetics or equivalent discipline with an interest in drug metabolism, pharmacokinetics (DMPK) and pharmacodynamics (PD) (recent PhDs might be taken into consideration if they are aware that this is a purely laboratory position, however candidates with just a BSc/MSc are strongly preferred)You gained good knowledge of metabolic enzyme biochemistry (e.g. CYP450, UGT), hands-on/experimental enzyme kinetics assessment and the respective experimental designs.Experience in bioanalytical method development/validation for radio-HPLC (e.g. Thermo®) and LC-MS/MS (e.g. Sciex®). This includes troubleshooting and data analysis (e.g.using Analyst® software).You have a strong interest in translational approaches leveraging in vitro data and clinical data.Fluent EnglishIf interested, please feel free to contact myself Ibrahim Bokolo via email: ibokolo@achieva.co.uk or +44 1727817642.

job_title: Ingenieurin / Ingenieur für Test-Management und Laborautomatisierung
job_description:
An unserem Standort im Team “Home and Office Appliancesâ Liebefeld konzipieren und entwickeln wir Geräte für unsere Partner im Bereich der “Beverage Dispensersâ, “Beverages-Technologies and Toolsâ, “Health, Food and Lifestyleâ und “Smart Home and Smart Industryâ.Das Team der “Labor Automation, Usability and Testingâ Gruppe sucht eine Persönlichkeit als:Ingenieurin / Ingenieur für Test-Management und LaborautomatisierungTätigkeitsgebietAls Testingenieurin oder Testingenieur werden Sie automatisierte Tests und Tester designen, implementieren und betreuen. Ihre Rolle ist es Systeme für ihre zentralen Eigenschaften zu analysieren, Test-Prozeduren für diese Eigenschaften zu entwickeln und Werkzeige zu erschaffen die die Integrität des entwickelten Systems in Relation zu den Requirements sicherstellen. WORKING FOR ONE OF THE BEST EMPLOYERS IN SWITZERLAND We are one of the top addresses in the IT world and focus on optimizing our customers' core business processes. Through the smart use of customized IT solutions, we support our customers in getting the best out of their business and current technologies. But we only achieve our success through one thing: the people at adesso! They bring together ideas, professional know-how and technologies. Together we program (your) future at adesso.What We Will Work On TogetherGenerate technical solutions that are based on the latest technological standards and also promote collaboration with the business by using common notation languages such as BPMN, CMMN and DMN on which the solution is built. This not only facilitates the modelling of the solution together with the business department, but also the comprehensibility of the solution, as the typical "dark processing" is minimized and the business can view the application flow in a diagram. But how can this potential be fully exploited for our customers?Combined with the disciplines of architecture, software engineering, user experience and collaboration, a disruptive technology such as technical BPM solutions can unleash completely new potential (e.g. low code and citizen development). Our mission is to make this potential accessible to our clients from a single source. In technology consulting, we support our clients in the successful use of BPM platforms in the "Evaluate", "Introduce" and "Scale" phases. This is where we work with you to implement BPM platforms such as Camunda and/or Flowable and support our clients at every stage of their journey. Introduction of BPM platforms taking into account their current IT landscape implementation of process-based software with Java/Spring Boot and the technical notations such as BPMN 2.0, CMMN 1.1, DMN 1.3 Enabling the use of the BPM platform as a citizen development platform by implementing extensions with Java/Spring Boot (or other gRPC-capable languages) and ReactWith industry and enterprise solutions, we tackle specific business problems by combining disruptive and established technologies to answer the relevant questions for our customers.As a BPM Engineer, you are an essential part of our mission and accompany our customers on their BPM journey.In order to generate results quickly, develop conceptually sound solutions and enable our customers to work independently with the platform, experience with the standard notation BPMN 2.0, CMMN 1.1 and/or DMN 1.3 and/or software engineering with BPM platforms such as Flowable or Camunda is a big plus. If you are already a pro - a double plus - If not, we will help you become a pro.What You Can Expect From UsWorking in different industries and changing project situations - from a one-day orientation workshop to the implementation of a solution module over several months - an exciting environment.In addition to project work, you will help shape the community by creating our solution modules and further developing technology consulting. We use the results together for project acquisition - working with innovative topics"Thinking outside the box", i.e. actively incorporating suitable technologies and methods and combining them profitablyPlenty of room for your experience and a wide range of tasksClose collaboration in a motivated, experienced and highly qualified team from various specialist areasIndependent work and responsibility in the project, in particular responsibility for solutions in the areas of conception and architectureHigh quality standards in all areasCooperation with scientific institutionsHigh appreciation for elegant, lean and solid solutionsA strong, globally active company behind you with continuous exchange, team spirit and respectful, appreciative interactionOpportunity Provider - What Makes Adesso SpecialOur promise: You will feel at home with us! Collegial, collaborative and on an equal footing - we live exchange, team spirit and respectful interaction. We value diversity and different perspectives just as much as you as a person. This and much more stands for our very special sense of togetherness. There's even a word for it: adessi.Our culture and the way we work together are characterized by mutual appreciation, recognition and support. This unites us - even when working from home. Part-time work is possible by arrangement (80-100%). We have once again been voted one of the best employers in Switzerland! Our extensive training program and a transparent career level model for everyone ensure that your development with us never stands still. job_title: Requirements Engineer / Business Analyst Elektromobilität (80-100%, w/m/d)
job_description:
Die Welt der Energie ist im Umbruch - und Elektromobilität eine ihrer grössten Chancen! Wir von simplee haben uns auf Elektromobilität und Ladeinfrastrukturen spezialisiert und sind mit 50 tollen Menschen das führende Team in der Schweiz mit reinem Fokus auf Elektromobilität!Wir beraten einerseits Unternehmen der Energie- und Elektrobranche und beliefern diese mit den innovativsten Ladelösungen (easee und Alpitronic). Andererseits betreuen wir Immobilienportfolios für institutionelle Immobilieneigentümer im Hinblick auf Ladeinfrastrukturen: Als Komplettanbieter unterstützen wir bei der Entwicklung der Emobility Strategie und übernehmen Planung, Projektumsetzung, Betrieb, Abrechnung, Skalierung sowie Support der Ladeinfrastrukturen.Hast du Lust, dich mit uns für nachhaltige Mobilität einzusetzen und unsere Partner und Kunden in das Zeitalter der Elektromobilität zu begleiten? Dann können wir es kaum erwarten, dich an Bord zu haben!AufgabenAls Requirements Engineer*in / Business Analyst*in mit IT-Hintergrund untersützt du unser Digitalisierungsteam in folgenden Bereichen:Prozessanalyse: Analyse von abteilungsinternen sowie -übergreifenden GeschäftsprozessenDigitalisierung: Entwicklung von Ideen gemeinsam mit den einzelnen Teams, wie Prozesse mit eigenen Tools, Applikationen und ERP Automatisierungen digitalisiert werden könnenEntwicklung und Koordination: Umsetzung der definierten Applikationen bzw. Koordination und Kommunikation mit unseren Entwicklungsagenturen, falls entschieden wird, diese extern entwickeln zu lassen.ERP Optimierung: Konfiguration und Erweiterung unseres ERP Systems Odoo wie auch Unterstützung beim Aufbau eines Integration-Layers zur Anbindung externer Systeme.QualifikationDu verfügst über mind. 5 Jahre Berufserfahrung als Requirements Engineer*in / Business Analyst*inDu hast Erfahrung mit HTML, XML, Python und/oder SQL sowie Scheduling Agents (zB. CTRL-M)Du begeisterst dich für das Thema Nachhaltigkeit und überzeugst dein Gegenüber durch echtes Interesse und Passion für deine Arbeit.In deiner Tätigkeit wirst du vielen verschiedenen Stakeholdern komplexe Zusammenhänge erklären, weshalb eine klare und gut strukturierte Ausdrucksweise auf Deutsch unabdingbar ist.Du arbeitest strukturiert und verfügst über ausgeprägte analytische sowie konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten.BenefitsWir möchten nicht nur in unserem Fachbereich innovative Wege beschreiten, sondern auch im Hinblick auf Unternehmenskultur neue Massstäbe setzen. Wir sind überzeugt, dass Teamspirit sowie Offenheit und der Anspruch an Exzellenz die Grundlagen für eine erfolgreiche interne wie externe Zusammenarbeit schafft. Arbeit und Spass gehören in unserem Arbeitsalltag zusammen!In deiner neuen Position bieten wir dir:Tolles Arbeitsklima mit hilfsbereiten Kolleginnen und Kollegen, die sich für ihre Arbeit begeistern und bereit sind, die Extrameile zu gehen.Die Möglichkeit, in einem jungen Unternehmen mitzuhelfen, weiterhin ein unglaubliches Wachstum zu erzielen.Und nicht zuletzt: Ein Unternehmen, in dem gerne gelacht wird!Weitere Infos zur Stelle:Arbeitsbeginn: per sofort oder nach VereinbarungArbeitspensum: 80-100%Arbeitsort: DübendorfWir freuen uns darauf, dich kennen zu lernen!Bitte hänge dem Bewerbungsformular folgende Unterlagen an:LebenslaufBegleitschreiben, in welchem du uns erklärst, was dich motiviert, dich bei uns zu bewerbenZeugnisse und DiplomeAngabe deiner ungefähren GehaltsvorstellungDein simplee Team

Then start your career at Accenture, one of the world's leading consulting and technology companies. Our agile teams are shaping the technologies of tomorrow and accelerating the digital transformation – join our team and live your passion in a position where you drive and shape the digitalization of our international clients. Unser Kunde ist ein modernes Digital/Tech Unternehmen. Die Firma kreiert innovative Lösungen für externe Kunden aus den Bereichen Banking, Insurance, Government, Transport, Industrie und Retail.Mit drei Standorte in der Schweiz (Zürich, Bern, Basel), hybride Arbeitsmodelle und Liquid Arbeitspensum zählt die Firma zu den besten Arbeitgebern in der Schweiz.Zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt suchen wir Dich als Senior .NET Entwickler (m/w/d).Ort: ZürichArbeitsmodell: hybrid – 1-2 Tage im Office, bis zu 3 Tage remote.Vollzeit oder Teilzeit möglich.Liquid Working.AufgabenDie Position:Du erweiterst und verbesserst die bestehenden Produkte oder entwickelst neue, innovative Lösungen für die vielfältigen Kunden aus den Bereichen Banking, Retail oder Government.Dich erwartet eine kollegiale Atmosphäre und eine tolle Arbeitsplatzkultur!Domain Driven Design, Event Sourcing, CQRS, Onion Architecture, Micro/Domain Services und Azure sind für dich kein fremdes Wort, sondern gehören zu den regelmässig benutzten Werkzeugen in deiner Developer Tätigkeit.Verantwortlichkeiten: Du unterstützt externe Kunden bei der Analyse, Konzeption und der Umsetzung von Softwareentwicklungsprojekten Dabei erstellst du technische Lösungskonzepte und setzt diese um, entweder als Individualentwicklung oder mittels angepasster Standardsoftware Architekturstandards sind dir wichtig und du führst diese auf Projektebene ein und stellst sicher, dass sie auch eingehalten werden Du beteiligst dich aktiv an projektvorbereitenden Tätigkeiten, Reviews, Requirements Engineering, Prototypen, etc.QualifikationDein Profil: Abgeschlossenes Informatikstudium (FH/Uni/ETH/EPFL) oder vergleichbare Ausbildung Stilsichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse Du bist ein Experte in der Konzeption und Umsetzung von Lösungen basierend auf dem Microsoft Technologie Stack mit Schwerpunkt auf .NET Core und .NET 5 Von dir entworfene Applikationen und Architekturen laufen in der Cloud unter Microsoft Azure oder on premise Mit Javascript Frontend-Applikationen (wie z. B. React oder Angular oder Vue.js) oder Client-Technologien wie WPF und ASP.NET (MVC) kennst du dich aus Du kennst die gängigen Software Architecture Patterns und weisst, wie man damit stabile Web APIs (z. B. mit REST) entwirft und weiterentwickeltErfahrung mit relationalen (z. B. MS SQL) und dokumentbasierten (z. B. MongoDB) Datenbanken.BenefitsWas ist für Dich noch als Teammitglied: Flexibilität Work-Life Balance, dank Liquid Working: Arbeitszeit ist Gleitzeit, Pensen können auf Monatsbasis angepasst werden: Deine Arbeitszeit richtet sich nach deinen Bedürfnissen. Wiedereinstiegsgarantie für Mütter bis zwei Jahre nach der Geburt. Spesen und Homeoffice Auslagen vergütet man pauschal. Bestellung von privaten Notebooks. Autoflottenrabatt. Weiterbildung: eigene interne Academy, Onsite- und Onlinetrainings. Unbezahlter Urlaub jederzeit möglich. Familienfreundliches Unternehmen: Spass für Dich und deine Familie in der Freizeit - Gratisbesucherkarten für den Zoo, oder Spiel und Spass im Museum Täglich frische Äpfel im Büro, Kaffee, Wasser und Bier – selbstverständlich gratis. Top ausgezeichnetes Unternehmen mit wunderbarer Arbeitspolitik und –kultur.

Reality Labs (RL) is helping people around the world come together and connect through world-class AR and VR hardware and software. RL is committed to driving the state of the art forward through relentless innovation as we recognize AR & VR’s potential to change the world is immense. As seen through the recent rebranding of Facebook to Meta, theork towards building the metaverse is a top priority for the company. All of our products, including our apps, now share a new vision: to help bring the metaverse to life.As part of the XR organization in Reality Labs, our team charter is to accelerate the innovation in AR and VR by providing data systems that allow ML and computer vision engineers in Reality Labs to move fast with high confidence. Our work includes frameworks and infrastructure for data collection, data storage and management, data discovery and insights and our primary customers are teams in Reality Labs that build the core features of current and future AR and VR products.AR and VR products present novel challenges that require innovative solutions using ML and computer vision. These include everything from hand tracking to scene reconstruction to AR navigation and much more. A common aspect for the teams that work on solving these challenges is that they require a large amount of data, both real and synthetically generated, and the quality of data infrastructure and tools have a direct impact on their ability to innovate quickly towards launching Metaverse experiences. Our infrastructure and systems are used across the Reality Labs organization, with petabytes of data and billions of samples being added yearly. As a central team serving a large and quickly growing organization, we have an impact opportunity across all the products being developed in Reality Labs.Software Engineer, Frontend Responsibilities:Full stack web/mobile application development with a variety of coding languagesCode using primarily Python, C/C++, PHP(Hack) and JavaScript/TypeScriptWork closely with our PM and design teams to define feature specifications and build products leveraging frameworks such as React & React NativeWork closely with operations and infrastructure to build and scale back-end servicesEstablish self as an owner of a particular component, feature or system with expert end-to-end understandingSuccessfully completes projects at large scope while maintaining a consistent high level of productivityMinimum Qualifications:6+ years of programming experience6+ years relevant experience building large-scale applications or similar experienceFullstack proficiency, able to deliver full e2e product solutions including Frontend (React, JavaScript/TypeScript, PHP)Experience building large-scale infrastructure applications or similar experienceDemonstrated experience driving change within an organisation and leading complex technical projectsMust obtain work authorization in country of employment (Switzerland) at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employmentPreferred Qualifications:BSc or MSc in Computer Science or related field (or equivalent industry experience)About Meta:Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Fortement engagée dans sa transformation digitale, la Vaudoise Assurances désire renforcer ses équipes en charge de l’évolution de ses applicatifs.Pour nous accompagner, nous recherchons un Business Analyst Technique Finance , qui travaillera en étroite collaboration avec les services métiers et les équipes techniques de la transformation digitale dans le but d'automatiser nos processus dans le domaine Finances et Asset Management.Les diverses missions qui vous attendentActivités D’analyse Récolter les exigences, rédiger les récits (story), mener les travaux de recherche et d'analyse sur la fonctionnalité Evaluer la pertinence des demandes et les formaliser par rapport à la valeur ajoutée pour l'entreprise Traduire les besoins métiers en spécifications techniques et fonctionnelles, en lien avec le SI et l’architecture Participer à l’estimation de l’effort de réalisation Accompagner et participer aux sessions de tests fonctionnels et UAT Identifier les dépendances avec d'autres applications et systèmes Conseiller les parties prenantes sur les alternatives métiers et techniques (internes et/ou externes) Evaluer les risques liés au produit/livrableActivités De Gestion Et De Coordination Préparer et animer les ateliers / workshops sur la capture des besoins Préparer et faire le compte rendu des ateliers pour distribution aux parties prenantes Collaborer activement avec les éditeurs, le PO, les Experts Métier & BA Métier ainsi que les équipes ITVotre Profil Une expérience d’au minimum 3 ans en tant que Business Analyst, avec une orientation technique. Une certification serait un plus. Formation supérieure type EPF, HES, HEC, UNI ou autre titre jugé équivalent en Informatique / domaine technique avec une composante informatique / expérience professionnelle équivalente Une expérience avérée dans l'intégration de solutions financières & comptables et/ou dans la collaboration avec des équipes de réalisation (Product Owner, Scrum Master, développeurs, testeurs, etc.) Une compréhension de l'architecture globale IT, des problématiques d'intégration (API, microservices, etc.) et des enjeux clés liés au Cloud Une maîtrise des outils Atlassian (Jira, Confluence, etc.) alliée à une très bonne connaissance des méthodologies agiles courantes (Scrum, Kanban, etc.) Langue maternelle française, maîtrise de l'anglais (oral et écrit, niveau C1 minimum), la connaissance de l’allemand serait un plusVous vous démarquez par votre orientation solutions et votre proactivité. Doté d’un très bon relationnel, vous aimez travailler de manière autonome ainsi qu’en équipe. Votre sens de la communication est excellent et votre curiosité vous motive à apprendre de nouvelles choses.Nous Vous Offrons Un environnement de travail sain dans une entreprise mutualiste labelisée "Meilleur Employeur" Des avantages sociaux multiples, dont la flexibilité dans l'organisation du travail Des valeurs humaines centrées sur le bien-être des collaborateurs Un travail au sein d'une équipe dynamique et passionnée Un soutien dans le développement et la formationNous nous réjouissons de recevoir votre dossier de candidature complet par voie digitale (avec curriculum vitae, lettre de motivation, copie des certificats de travail et diplômes).
